jobDescription: Job Description Account Manager, FortiMonitor Fortinet is seeking a Monitoring Account Manager that will manage and drive sales engagements in partnership with Field Sales. The FortiMonitor Account Manager will partner with a FortiMonitor Systems Engineer and support customer engagements with Field Systems Engineers, Field Sales, engage with Product Management/Marketing, and end customers to deliver a revenue objective for the FortiMonitor product platform. In this role, you will identify visibility and performance challenges within your customers’ environment and drive opportunities to close in partnership with Field Sales/Field Systems Engineers and yourself as a FortiMonitor Account Manager. Training and enablement to sales teams and assisting with channel partners will be key to ensuring the success of the assigned territory. Primary Responsibilities Develop and manage internal sales relationships, as well as, be a key point of contact for FortiMonitor opportunities with the end customer Build and implement account / marketing plans for account penetration Generate a sales pipeline, qualify opportunities, and accurately forecast pipeline Achievement of agreed quarterly sales goals Channel effectiveness: Adept at working/developing opportunities with ecosystem partners Excellent communicator including the ability to make engaging and effective presentations to an executive audience Effective in a collaborative environment, particularly interacting with product and business professionals Collaborate with Regional Sales Managers and Regional Systems Engineers ensuring customers understand how to deliver value to their customers and partners with FortiMonitor Establish yourself as a trusted advisor to prospects and customers working with the Field Sales and Engineering teams Deliver outstanding service and problem resolution to Fortinet customers Required Skills Fully qualified, experienced sales professional that is forward thinking and has an expert understanding of the technology business sector Exceptional business and financial acumen with a demonstrated ability to understand both short-term and long-term financial impact of business decisions Previous experience designing business plans and market strategies Proven ability with solution selling A proven track record of quota achievement and demonstrated career stability A self-motivated, independent thinker that can move deals through the selling cycle Competitive, Self-starter, Hunter-type mentality. Previous experience in infrastructure monitoring. Knowledgeable in the following technologies: services/application performance monitoring, network performance monitoring, digital experience/synthetic monitoring. Strong analytical, communication and presentation skills to evaluate complex problems to find a systematic approach to gain a quick resolution. Education Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience. About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Job Description Accounting Manager We are seeking a motivated, experienced accountant to join our growing team. This position requires an organized, technically proficient accountant with an analytical mind and the ability to learn. The Sr. GL Accountant will be responsible for a wide range of accounting activities including preparing monthly GL entries and account reconciliations, preparing and updating schedules and analyses for internal and external reporting purposes, interfacing with foreign entities third party service providers and generally supporting the accounting process. The role will also involve collaborating with cross-functional teams. Functions & Responsibilities Assist with month-end close including, but not limited to, journal entries and reconciling accounts Prepare and review schedules, reporting packages and analytics Assist with monthly flux analysis of balance sheet and income statement accounts for management review Participate in financial transformation initiatives, implement process changes and establish best practices Coordinate with other departments to obtain transaction information and resolve issues Assist with ad-hoc projects and management inquiries Assist with system implementation projects Assist in quarterly reviews and annual audit with external auditors. Abilities & Competencies 6-9 years’ minimum progressive experience in Finance or Accounting roles Big 4 experience or CPA preferred Familiarity with common accounting issues, financial statement line items and financial metrics/ratios Experience with Oracle or similar global ERP system Strong analytical skills, creative problem-solving, and ability to summarize conclusions succinctly Flexibility and comfort with continuous change, willingness to take on challenges Ability to prioritize multiple duties and work independently Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to actively and attentively listen High degree of dedication to improvement and strong sense of ownership High standards of customer service to contacts both within and outside the company Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Knowledge of Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.

Job Description Position: Accounting Manager Location: Sunnyvale, CA Business Fortinet is a global leader and innovator in network security. We provide high performance cybersecurity solutions to a wide variety of enterprises and government organizations of all sizes across the globe. We provide protection against cyberattacks across the entire attack surface through a broad range of security products and solutions, providing customers with an end-to-end platform and a single source of threat intelligence to minimize security gaps. For 2022, we project our billings to be in excess of $5 billion and we are supported by a world-wide employee group of +11,000 in more than 50 countries. Position Summary The Accounting Manager will report to the Director of Cost Accounting. In this role you will be a key member of the finance team at Fortinet and will be responsible for collaborating with cross-functional teams, reconciling balance sheet & P&L accounts, owning processes from end-to-end, controls, and providing financial support. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, great communicator, is passionate about managing change in a dynamic fast-paced environment, and continually looking for ways to help the team become more efficient and effective. In this role you will have an opportunity to work closely with cross-functional teams and have the ability to support senior management in accounting related issues. Major Responsibilities Delivery of accurate, timely, and efficient accounting processes including preparation of month-end and quarter-end close activities, monthly and quarterly balance sheet and P&L account reconciliations, etc. Record necessary journal entries throughout the quarter (Oracle knowledge preferred) Collaborate with GL team and Supply Chain team to obtain necessary information to perform month-end and quarter-end procedures and deliver accurate financial support timely. Prepare and review inventory accounting processes, including preparing the Excess & Obsolete workbook analysis and analyzing key drivers for changes quarter over quarter. Work with external auditors for SOX, quarterly, and year-end audit requests. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support new and ongoing business initiatives, improve process efficiencies / scalability for continued operational excellence. Key relationships Director of Cost Accounting SEC Reporting and Technical Accounting team GL team Supply chain team External Auditors Essential Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance. 5+ years Must be super user for Excel and Oracle Strong understanding of typical financial statement line items and financial metrics/ratios Strong understanding of inventory and cost accounting Experience with Oracle or similar global ERP system, preferred Strong analytical skills, creative problem-solving, and ability to summarize conclusions succinctly Ability to prioritize multiple duties and work independently Excellent verbal and written communication skills High degree of dedication to improvement and strong sense of ownership Knowledge of Word, PowerPoint

Job Description Fortinet is currently looking for a TAM Manager to join our Advanced Support organization. Along with having previous supervisory experience, the ideal candidate will be energetic and passionate about working for Fortinet and supporting our Advanced Support team. This is a great opportunity to learn all aspects of the products that we support in an innovative, fast-paced environment while expanding your knowledge in network security. Responsibilities Provide first level supervision to a group of TAM engineers, managing workload, response, resolution and quality. Monitor and manage support engineer queues and escalate issues as necessary. Perform routine case reviews and provide feedback. Participate in the quality calibration and validation process Improve productivity by highlighting deficiencies and recommending changes in methods, processes and tools. Monitor and manage operational and customer satisfaction metrics to meet organizational goals. Provide input to training and development planning and performance evaluations. Manage customer escalations; follow up with customer satisfaction surveys. Build and maintain strong relationships with sales Qualifications At least 2+ years of support management experience. Demonstrated leadership skills. Excellent organizational skills. At least 2+ experience with direct customer interaction, preferably in a supervisory role. At least 2+ years experience in a technical support role in a networking/security company or equivalent education Understanding of TCP/IP, routing protocols, L2/L3 switches Experience working in with security products firewalls, IPSec, IDS/IPS, Anti Spam, virus scanning Troubleshooting and problem solving skills Working knowledge of Windows, UNIX or Linux Previous call center experience, preferably supporting data networking products and/or security products is desirable. Strong English skills both written and verbal. Professional Requirements Energized by making customers happy and successful A passion for collaboration and a deep understanding of the Internet security technology Translator between business, technical, and sales people Excellent organizational, analytical and negotiation skills Phenomenal communication skills are a must for this job Driven to create success in a hopeless situation, through brilliant problem solving, communication, and relentless persistence Able to perform well in the face of tight deadlines and tough technical and organizational challenges Steadfast and calm in explosive situations Educational Requirement Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field, or an equivalent combination of training and experience is desirable. Job Description Alliance Marketing Intern Fortinet, a leading Silicon Valley cybersecurity company, is recruiting an Alliance Marketing Intern in our Sunnyvale headquarters. If you are looking for a career in a high-energy, professional work environment at a company that values and rewards your contributions, challenges you to shape your career path, and provides top-notch personal development, then this is internship is for you. Besides working on impactful projects, you will participate in a lunch and learn session with our executives, networking activity, and project showcase. About You Self-motivated, a problem solver, and enthusiastic "can-do" attitude with a passion for learning and growing in cybersecurity You are a leader and excellent teammate with experience in a collaborative team environment, ability to manage priorities and a drive for results Responsibility Assist the Global Technology Alliances team in managing and driving marketing and program initiatives with Fortinet's Global Technology Alliance Partners. Manage program operations for partner program management, including partner tools, and day-to-day support of the Fortinet technology alliance partner ecosystem. Drive website updates and alliance marketing collateral development to reflect and promote alliance integrations and partnerships Drive event planning and facilitate agreements between all stakeholders. Assist with partner communications and coordination to support Fortinet and alliance partner marketing events. Track alliance marketing campaigns and partner performance for partnership planning. Assist with the development of alliances marketing collateral Creating and driving the development of the alliance newsletter once a quarter. Qualifications Currently a Junior or Senior enrolled in a four-year degree program in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field with expected graduation date winter 2021 or spring 2022 At least one plus years’ experience in marketing, communications, alliances/partnerships or project management highly desirable The ideal candidate will be innovative, team-oriented, an effective communicator, have a desire to participate in change and ability to prioritize projects in a fast pace environment Must able to demonstrate strong knowledge with MS Suite, communication, speaking, and writing skills About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Job Description Responsibilities: Participate in software development for next generation security processor hardware. This is an opportunity to learn from and have impact on the design of industry-leading security processor. Debug and optimize network and network security functions. Evaluate module-level and system-level performance through simulation. Closely work with the ASIC design team, the driver teams and the field engineers. This is a unique position to learn from and work with multiple groups of people. Job Requirements Strong with C/C++ programming for embedded systems. Solid understanding of computer architecture, network protocols, and related algorithms. Passion and willingness to learn and explore new technologies and new methodologies. Good communication skills. 3+ years of related experience. Nice to have: Experience with Python programming. Description: Bilingual English and Spanish Technical Support Engineer will provide product support for Fortinet’s FortiNAC solution. A challenging and satisfying opportunity for a highly motivated customer centric individual to work in a multi-tiered support team assisting customers with “FortiNAC” questions, configuration, and break fix issues. The individual is experienced in security policies and procedures, network access control, firewalls, IP networks, routing, switching, wireless, authentication services, end stations, or other network security devices. Completes assigned duties and can act independently with minimal direction while researching and developing solutions to customer issues. The support engineer is the technical point of contact for customers. Responsibilities: • Provide technical support to customers, field engineers and partners. • Prioritizes customer needs, acts, and responds appropriately. • Handling customer technical support cases through phone and portal submission. • Conducts research to find answers to questions and solutions to problems. • Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including product setup, and configuration along with network infrastructure integration configuration. • Talk clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email, or chat, to incident resolution. • Point of contact for escalated customer issues. Triage conferences with the customer to ensure all parties are on the same page, actions are documented and tracked, resolution path is understood and communicated. Act as of the voice of the customer. • Maintaining system functionality by regression testing product components. • Achieve incident resolution objectives through collecting relevant data, identifying, and evaluating options and suggesting a course(s) of action. • Preparing reference material for users by drafting operation instructions. • Document all technical inquiries in ticket comments. • Develop and review content for knowledgebase. • Update support community with tech tips and brief documents. • Maintain client confidence by keeping their information confidential. Qualifications: • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems or like field • 3 years of experience working as a Technical Support Engineer • Bilingual in English and Spanish is required • Knowledge of network topology in multi-vendor environments • Experience with Linux appliance-based solutions • Excellent listening skills with fluent written and oral communication in English and Spanish • Demonstrated skills at working within a team environment • Positive and consistent customer support and service attitude • Ability to establish technical credibility with customers • Ability to multi-task multiple customer incidents • Ability to troubleshoot heterogeneous environments • A passion for problem solving and executing a customer issue resolution plan

Job Description Business/Data Analyst Key Responsibilities Determine operational objectives critical to business functions, gather information, provide analysis on best approach for benefit of the organization. Responsible for process workflow and supporting documentation, diagrams of business functions. Facilitate ERP and integrated functional and system testing processes through Identification and documentation of test scenarios and scripts Data identification, collection and cleansing Responsible for monitoring related business risks, issues and helping to facilitate business decisions. Responsible for working with SOX auditors to create and document work flows to ensure compliance. Contributes fully to the work of teams. Plan, schedule, and monitors own work and the work of others, where applicable. Ability to work effectively in a multi-vendor environment. Broad range of work, sometimes complex and non-routine, in a variety of environments. Minimum Requirements Cloud ERP implementation team experience. Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems. Ability to work effectively as part of a team. Ability to effectively communicate with others verbally; recognizing that verbal communication is more than just language it includes tone, style, and structure. Strong writing and presentation skills is a must. Education And Experience Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business Administration or related field Minimum of 3+ years prior business analyst or project implementation experience. Experience with a cloud enterprise ERP rollout, preferably Oracle. SOX related experience. Requires proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and PowerPoint. Self-starter with minimal guidance and supervision is desired while juggling multiple priorities. Effectively communicate and influence professionals at all levels internally, externally and cross functionally. Job Description Business Development Representative – Manager Sunnyvale, CA The Company Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network—today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud, or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 450,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Complementary Products Can Be Deployed With a FortiGate To Enable a Simplified, End-to-end Security Infrastructure Covering Our flagship enterprise firewall platform, FortiGate , is available in a wide range of sizes and form factors to fit any environment and provides a broad array of next-generation security and networking functions. Network Security - Protect the entire attack surface from headquarters to branch offices with advanced security. Multi-Cloud Security - Complete visibility and control across the cloud that enables secure applications and connectivity. Secure Access - Deliver secure application, device access, and management without compromising performance and speed. Security Operations - Implement advanced threat intelligence to detect, prevent, and respond sophisticated malware and improve security awareness. Network Operations - Leverage a smart security strategy that prioritizes automation-driven network operations that spots and prevents network breaches. Endpoint and Device Protection - Proactive protection, visibility, and control for all endpoints and devices across the network. Application Security - Protect critical business web applications with an integrated set of products to thwart advanced threats. Our market position and solution effectiveness have been widely validated by industry analysts, independent testing labs, business organizations, and media outlets worldwide. We are proud to count the majority of Fortune 500 companies among our satisfied customers. Fortinet is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, with offices around the globe. Founded in 2000 by Ken Xie , the visionary founder and former president and CEO of NetScreen, Fortinet is led by a strong management team with deep experience in networking and security. Role Description The Business Development Representative (BDR) Manager will lead a defined group of BDR’s supporting a specific geographic region. The BDR Manager will be responsible for leading a team of BDR’s that are responsible for identifying and engaging contacts in target accounts with the goal of setting qualified meetings for the sales organization. The Business Development Manager will have a quarterly quota to support the company’s growth goals. Job Description Business Development Representative – Manager The Company Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network—today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud, or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 450,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Complementary Products Can Be Deployed With a FortiGate To Enable a Simplified, End-to-end Security Infrastructure Covering Our flagship enterprise firewall platform, FortiGate , is available in a wide range of sizes and form factors to fit any environment and provides a broad array of next-generation security and networking functions. Network Security - Protect the entire attack surface from headquarters to branch offices with advanced security. Multi-Cloud Security - Complete visibility and control across the cloud that enables secure applications and connectivity. Secure Access - Deliver secure application, device access, and management without compromising performance and speed. Security Operations - Implement advanced threat intelligence to detect, prevent, and respond sophisticated malware and improve security awareness. Network Operations - Leverage a smart security strategy that prioritizes automation-driven network operations that spots and prevents network breaches. Endpoint and Device Protection - Proactive protection, visibility, and control for all endpoints and devices across the network. Application Security - Protect critical business web applications with an integrated set of products to thwart advanced threats. Our market position and solution effectiveness have been widely validated by industry analysts, independent testing labs, business organizations, and media outlets worldwide. We are proud to count the majority of Fortune 500 companies among our satisfied customers. Fortinet is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, with offices around the globe. Founded in 2000 by Ken Xie , the visionary founder and former president and CEO of NetScreen, Fortinet is led by a strong management team with deep experience in networking and security. Job Description Job Summary: A SAT-BDM is a senior technical sales person, part of a specialized team, who will work as a business advisor for the local channel and accounts teams. The SAT-BDM engages in strategic deals where his knowledge of secure access architecture will affect the reach of Fortinet solution, bring to our customer a more broaden approach to their security needs. The SAT-BDM works alongside with peer field channel, account teams, and channel partners that may be involved, throughout the sales process. The SAT-BDM is expected to shape the positive outcome of customer engagements such as presentations, meetings while showing the benefits of the proposed access architecture. This role offers high visibility to senior management, networking across corporate teams as well as the opportunity to shape the business and the direction of our access products. This individual will work together with the Area vice president to create strategies to extend Fortinet’s Advanced Technologies and Lan Edge reach throughout the region. Experience 7+ years of related extensive proven experience in selling or consulting network access solutions in a customer-facing role. 7+ years in costumer facing presentations and creation of sales enablement material Minimum 5+ experience on cybersecuriry/networking, designing, and consulting roles Excellent understanding of cybersecurity technologies and architectures. Excellent written and verbal communication, listening, negotiation and presentation skills. Capable of delivering product and technology presentations to technical and business audiences. Ability to work effectively, to add value as a team member, and collaborate with a variety of teams such as engineering, sales, product management and customer support. Responsibilities Create sales strategies and enable extended sales team to apply these strategies Understanding of sales process from prospection of new opportunities till closure Maximize Fortinet opportunity while providing value added solutions enhancing the offer with access products Works closely together with the local account managers in order to maximize the primary business focus Develops relationships with key decision makers, influencers and partners Manages effective working relationships with assigned regional sales and engineering teams Travels within assigned territory is required 50% of the time Requirements Excellent presentation skills to executives & individual contributors Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience in managing large deals A self-motivated, independent thinker that together with the local team can move deals through the selling cycle Candidate must thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment Competitive, Self-starter Team player Knowledge of SalesForce or equivalent Education, Certifications, Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent. English, Spanish and Portuguese is required. Job Description Business development Manager OT - Greece Location: Athens / Greece Language/s: Fluent Greek and English Why Fortinet? Fortinet is one of the fastest-growing cybersecurity companies in the world. We have proven to be a truly innovative technology driven IT security Company. Fortinet’s mission is to deliver the most innovative, highest-performing network security fabric to secure and simplify IT infrastructures. Today we secure the largest enterprises, service providers and government organizations across the globe. The OT EMEA Team Experienced and driven professionals, who enjoy building connections and nurturing partnerships to address most critical cybersecurity concerns, across the areas of Operational Technology (OT) / Industrial control systems (ICS) / IoT / industry 4.0. The ability to identify opportunities, plan the course of action and engage the necessary resources to form and deliver successful business outcomes, is our team’s most valuable attribute. Your Goals Maximize the Fortinet opportunity coverage and brand awareness within the OT / ICS / Automation Utilize your relationship-building skills to establish and expand a robust network of profitable relationships and alliances with a variety of distributors, integrators, re-sellers and consulting houses Successfully achieve regional sales targets About You Min. 5 years of Experience in Managing Industrial Accounts in Greece, for Cybersecurity solutions in the OT Self-driven individual to succeed in every challenge , with thirst to own a business domain Able to go-to-market via (1) channel, (2) direct to customers (3) through Fortinet’s Sales staff and (4) 3 rd party advisory organizations Enjoy building relationships, motivate, educate, enable, train the market and the channel partner community Proven track record of meeting and exceeding targets and quotas Proficiency with data analysis, forecasting, budgeting and ability to plan and manage resources Eagerness to be constantly out in the market meeting clients and partners and justify the value of our solutions What we offer? Competitive basic salary, uncapped commission with progressive multiplicators. Flexible working approach, this is a field-based role, you can operate from anywhere in Greece Empowering and supportive working environment, where you can be yourself Innovative, collaborative and dynamic company with a double-digit growth over the last decade. Training on the job with many other formal trainings and industry recognized certifications. Our Commitment Fortinet is an equal opportunity employer. We value the diversity in our company, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality in addition to any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. #LI - PH1

Description Job Description The Business Development Specialist provides support to the North American Sales Team by generating, identifying and qualifying leads. The Business Development Specialist creates and uses lists and databases from strategic accounts, target campaigns, marketing events and 3rd party services to achieve their lead generation goals. Responsibilities Perform out-bound phone calls and emails to identify, engage and/or penetrate qualified leads from strategic accounts generated by various marketing events: lunch & learns, events, webinars and target campaigns. Schedule website/ in-person demonstrations, sales appointments for assigned regional account team. Track lead generation, engagement and performance through Salesforce.com Update and monitor all qualified leads converted to opportunities Required Skills Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills. Well-organized with effective time and activity-management skills. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Goal-oriented, able to meet and exceed monthly/quarterly goals. Confident with the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment. Able to work independently as well as on a team. Ideal candidate has interest or experience with technology sales. Responsibilities Perform out-bound phone calls and emails to identify, engage and/or penetrate qualified leads from strategic accounts generated by various marketing events: lunch & learns, events, webinars and target campaigns. Schedule website/ in-person demonstrations, sales appointments for assigned regional account team. Track lead generation, engagement and performance through Salesforce.com Update and monitor all qualified leads converted to opportunities Required Skills Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills. Well-organized with effective time and activity-management skills. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Goal-oriented, able to meet and exceed monthly/quarterly goals. Confident with the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment. Able to work independently as well as on a team. Ideal candidate has interest or experience with technology sales. Education BS in Business Administration or related fields About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommadations@fortinet.com. Fortinet is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in our company, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

Job Description Fortinet is a fast-growing and dynamic cybersecurity company with a growing and hard-working marketing team. We are looking for six Business Development Interns to participate in the fall early talent program starting in September 2022 virtually. You'll be working with the Business development organization, where we drive sales through targeted prospecting, collaboration within the sales org and defined selling tactics & sequences. You'll be exposed to working with business development through sales & marketing initiatives. Besides working directly with a team lead, you will be able to interact with the entire business development organization to better understand the processes that will ensure a successful transition into a full-time position. About You Self-motivated, a problem solver, and enthusiastic "can-do" attitude with a passion for learning and growing Skilled in critical thinking, communication & objection handling. Responsibility Forecasting metrics (help track productivity against department goals) Calling down webinar/registration lists Shadowing full-time BDRs Familiarizing themselves with tech stack/SFDC Data hygiene (scrubbing leads) NSE Trainings- perhaps help with enablement initiatives? Pitch training/workshops Executive fireside chats Socials/Happy Hours Qualification Currently a Junior or rising Senior enrolled in a four-year degree program pursuing a Business, Marketing, Sales, Communications or related field degree with expected graduation date Spring 2022 to Spring 2023 A passion for cybersecurity and an aptitude for learning solving a complex problem The ideal candidate will be innovative, team-oriented, an effective communicator, have a desire to participate in change and ability to prioritize projects in a fast pace environment Must able to demonstrate strong knowledge with selling techniques, prospecting tools, communication, speaking, and writing skills About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with disabilities. Job Description Business Development Intern (Spring 2023) Fortinet is one of the world’s leaders in all things cybersecurity and we’re looking for great people to join our growing team! We’re recruiting four (4) full-time/part-time Business Development Interns to join our Spring 2023 Internship & Early Talent Program. In this role, you'll be working with the business development organization, where we drive sales through targeted prospecting, collaboration within the sales organization and defined selling tactics and sequences. You'll be exposed to working with business development through sales and marketing initiatives. Besides working directly with a team lead, you will be able to interact with the entire business development organization to better understand the processes that will ensure a successful transition into a full-time position. Majority of these internships will be based out of our headquarters in Sunnyvale, California; with the exception of 1-2 where interns can work from our office in Frisco, Texas. About You Self-motivated, a problem solver, and enthusiastic "can-do" attitude with a passion for learning and growing. Skilled in critical thinking, communication & objection handling. Job Duties Forecasting metrics (help track productivity against department goals) Calling down webinar/registration lists Shadowing full-time BDRs Familiarizing yourself with tech stack/SFDC Data hygiene (scrubbing leads) NSE Trainings Pitch training/workshops Executive fireside chats Socials/Happy Hours Qualifications Currently a Senior enrolled in a four-year degree program pursuing a Business, Marketing, Sales, Communications or related field degree with expected graduation date of Summer or Winter 2023. A passion for cybersecurity and an aptitude for learning solving a complex problem. The ideal candidate will be innovative, team-oriented, an effective communicator, have a desire to participate in change and ability to prioritize projects in a fast pace environment. Must able to demonstrate strong knowledge with selling techniques, prospecting tools, communication, speaking, and writing skills. About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Job Description Channel Financial Analyst Frisco TX Fortinet is looking to hire a dynamic, highly motivated Financial Analyst to join the WW Sales Finance team. The successful candidate will be forward thinking and care deeply about continually improving the teams’ assessment of Fortinet’s channel investment decisions. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health of our Channel business. You will support Fortinet’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You will provide accurate and timely information on financial trends and assist with the management of global channel programs. As such, the successful candidate requires proficiency and working knowledge of finance, accounting, business and business analysis. Roles And Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To Support Sales Finance and WW Channel Management in investment decisions Communicate and help continually develop investment rules across the business Provide insights and updates on performance/ROI on a timely basis Consolidate, assemble, summarize and analyze financial data including financial, business, customer and market information to structure sophisticated management reports Identify trends based on sound analysis Coordinate, manage and track results for channel programs Collaborate with both local and worldwide teams Ability to pivot and adapt to a changing environment and business needs Qualifications A strong bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline (including, but not limited to Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics or Business) Proficient in spreadsheets, databases, MS Office and financial software applications Good problem solving skills Strong verbal and written professional skills; ability to compile and present data, insights, and recommendations to different audiences, including executives Strong attention to detail Business partnership and teamwork- ability to collaborate with both local and worldwide teams Highly motivated self-starter Preferred Qualifications Experience effectively partnering with business and operational stakeholders Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, manage multiple assignments simultaneously, and provide clarity and structure Solid understanding of P&L elements and experience with Forecast/Close processes a plus

Job Description Fortinet Channel Marketing Manager – Dallas About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security features without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks #1 in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 400,000 customers trust Fortinet. What you will do? Build strong relationship with regional Sales Leadership to understand where marketing efforts can be best utilized in order to help drive sales Design and launch scalable campaigns across the regional partner community to generate revenue, foster engagement and to position Fortinet as a leader in cybersecurity. Play a key role in helping strategic channel partners develop quarterly marketing strategies and plans designed to drive demand and pipeline. Assist partners with the execution of Fortinet marketing campaigns and program as needed with the goal of making partners self-sufficient in executing a marketing strategy Develop channel marketing strategy for the region as well as key tactics Drive channel (partner) marketing plan development and execution thru Channel Account Managers to drive demand, awareness and leads. Provide Partners with guidance on Fortinet tools, content and assets available for their use as part of the Fortinet marketing campaigns. Develop & manage regional budget and allocate MDF and set marketing goals and objectives for strategic partners based on ROI opportunity and partner performance Regularly review, prepare and share with key stakeholder key information such as partner billing information, marketing fund spent, Marketing Generated Opportunity (MGO) attained and pipeline to ensure acceptable ROI Deliver fully integrated awareness/consideration/preference and/or demand generation campaigns for successful partner execution. Design innovative partner marketing approaches and campaign strategies, success metrics and manage delivery/execution calendar. Leverage, develop, and enhance a variety of programs & campaigns that drive demand generation and revenue growth Develop/Own campaign execution tracking with associated metrics/goals/ benchmarks; track/report progress against them, evaluate event/campaign ROI Develop closed-loop post analysis for marketing campaigns and identify/execute indicated actions. Define and share partner led campaign execution best practices with marketing team members Execute end-to-end virtual and in-person event logistics (webinars, executive roundtables, trade shows, conferences). Provide onsite event support as required Track partner performance based on growth metrics such as billings, Y/Y growth, pipeline generation, funding ROI, etc Attend and participate in regular partner business meetings and QBRs to provide marketing strategy and guidance Attend and participate in regular internal sales, channel, and marketing meetings to share recent campaign wins, upcoming activities, and action items Distribute and roll-out corporate initiatives for successful field & channel execution Manage and distribute regular team communications across multiple platforms Experience using platforms such as Salesforce, Tableau, Teams, Swoogo, GTW/Zoom, Sharepoint, Microsoft Office 5 years Channel Marketing Manager experience

Job Description Position: Cloud Channel Account Manager Location: US Remote Objective: Incubate, nurture and proactively grow Fortinet’s public cloud security business through cloud channel partners with expertise in Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Oracle Cloud. The focus of the Cloud Channel Account Manager will be to: Recruit and manage partners such as Regional System Integrators (RSI’s), Managed Service Providers (MSP’s), Managed Security Service Providers (MSSP’s), VARs, Consultants and Advisors. Lead partner business development, enablement, and sales/GTM campaigns that drive the consumption of Fortinet’s public cloud security products. Engage and build relationships with regional channel resources at each of the four public cloud service providers. Responsibilities Develop a portfolio of public cloud partners; identify short-term and long-term goals. Build and execute partner business plans that drive profitable growth for partners and Fortinet. Proactively work with partners to drive incremental sales pipeline and revenues through business/technical enablement and GTM support. Orchestrate resources from Fortinet marketing, legal, finance, channel operations and other teams across Fortinet. Create, monitor and share KPIs regularly with internal stakeholders to measure growth and to identify areas that need attention. Build relationships and deliver value to partner executives and other stakeholders. Required Skills, Knowledge & Experience 3+ years of public cloud solution sales through channel partners and partner account management. Networking and/or security experience is a plus. Deep understanding of the challenges, issues and impact of end customers’ cloud journeys across major public clouds listed above. Experience working in public cloud ecosystems, marketplaces and co-sell engagements with public cloud service providers. Ability to articulate use cases and solutions based on Fortinet’s cloud security portfolio. Experience building business and marketing plans with partners that illustrate paths to partner monetization and profitability. Experience in delivering sales trainings Ability to communicate with executives as well as individual contributors. College or University degree preferred.

Objective Job Description Support sales activities as a strategic and high-level technical resource supporting vital enterprise pre-sales engagements and key opportunities. Develop And Maintain Responsibilities: Core competency on Fortinet’s entire product line and technologies Expert-level technical and marketing knowledge in one of four specific technology disciplines as they relate to Fortinet’s products: Network Security Infrastructure – Switching, Routing, SD-WAN and Availability Network Security Enforcement – Firewall/VPN; Access, Authentication, and Privacy Network Security Management – Centralized Configuration, Administration, and Reporting Network Security Intelligence – Application-level Security, SASE, ZTNA Product knowledge of Fortinet’s key competitors. Job Description Fortinet is seeking a SOC Consulting Systems Engineer that will be a responsible for a mixture of pre-sales systems engineering, and providing technical guidance to internal sales stakeholders. The SOC Consulting Systems Engineer will partner with and support customer engagements with Field Systems Engineers, Field Sales, engage with Product Management/Marketing, and end customers to deliver a revenue objective for the SOC suite of products. In this role, you will identify complex security challenges within your customers’ environment and drive opportunities to close in partnership with Field Sales/Field Systems Engineers and your SOC subject matter experts. Training and enablement to sales teams and providing feedback to Product Management teams on new feature requests or product improvements will be key to ensure the business is aware of key learnings from customer environments. Primary Responsibilities Manage pre-sales and post sales technical engagements to optimize customer value derived from FortiSIEM, FortiSOAR, and SOCaaS Collaborate with Regional Systems Engineers ensuring customers understand how to deliver value to their organization with the SOC products Establish yourself as a trusted advisor to prospects and customers working with the Field Sales and Engineering teams Lead technical training activities for internal and external customer and partners – leading our Field Engineering teams to provide successful demonstrations that showcase the value of our SOC solutions vs our competitors Lead the conversations with customers about security and IT trends in the industry related to their specific environment Knowledge of working with a channel community and enabling partners to understand our differentiated value Deliver outstanding service and problem resolution to Fortinet customers Understand client wants/needs and work with Product Management team to suggest, design, and deliver product enhancements and solutions Conduct Proof of Concepts and manage project plan for successful implementation and opportunity conversion with team Support Professional Services team with knowledge of customer environment Required Skills Strong technical and hands-on skills, strong pre-sales skill 5+ years of experience in technical/pre-sales support as a Sales or Systems Engineer Experience with selling SIEM, or SOAR technology or similar networking with security experience. Broad understanding of data center and public cloud architecture. Strong analytical, communication and presentation skills to evaluate complex problems to find a systematic approach to gain a quick resolution Project planning skills Proficiency with cloud networking models and connectivity, network security, virtualization, and cloud computing Ability to work independently with little direction – occasional travel within the United States and Canada Education Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience. Job Description Job Title: Contracts Analyst Position Summary The Contracts Analyst is accountable for reviewing purchase contracts and documents, supporting the procurement process, enforcing Fortinet procurement policies and providing a check and balance. This includes, but is not limited to procedural development projects, reviewing and negotiating contract terms, managing vendor relationships, and reducing costs with vendors. Key Responsibilities Plan, develop, and implement purchasing policies and procedures, including procedural and system enhancements for an efficient / effective workflow. Coordinate with the cross-functional teams in the development and execution of all aspects of an integrated procurement process. Analyze data reports for internal auditing and policy enforcement. Ensure proper documentation for vendor management. Create and/ or prepare PowerPoint presentations, training materials, and act as a subject matter expert for Fortinet employees on the procurement and related processes. Manage negotiations of vendor terms and conditions (e.g. Master Services Agreements, SOWs, PO terms and conditions) Manages the review, drafting and negotiation of vendor terms and conditions for a variety of purchasing contracts (e.g.: master services agreements, SOWs, service providers, marketing agreements, IT agreements, licensing, including SaaS and Cloud other procurement related agreements) Requirements Desire to gain project management, purchasing and process development experience Strong communication and presentation skills with attention to detail Independent thinker, self-starter with passion about procurement/purchasing Demonstrated project and time management skills for juggling many changing priorities and working under tight deadlines. Knowledge of contracts and P2P processes Solid computer skills, including MS Excel etc Strong analytical skills with a goal-oriented attitude Experience with contract management systems and Oracle is a plus. Ability to organize & prioritize, multitask, and perform accurately, efficiently and effectively in a high-paced work environment. Must have strong time management skills. Ability to successfully employ interpersonal skills to develop strong working relationships and customer service with internal and external stakeholders and resolve conflicts. Education Bachelor’s Degree in public administration, business administration or an equivalent education and three years of related experience. Legal experience is a plus. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. The ideal candidate will have knowledge of the technology/computer industry, preferably cybersecurity.

Job Description Fortinet is currently looking for Customer Service Representative to join our Sunnyvale Office to provide exceptional customer service for our loyal customers. The ideal candidate is energetic and passionate about working for Fortinet and supporting our Customers, while developing good and respected relationships with both internal and external customers. This is a great opportunity to excel in an innovative, fast-paced environment while expanding your knowledge and developing your skills in network security. Job Responsibilities Troubleshoot and resolve Customer Service related queries through phone, chat and web tickets in accordance with Fortinet policies and procedures. Professionally screen incoming customer calls, assist with ticket creation, verify entitlement and route customers to the appropriate team within the Customer Service & Support organization. Develop a good understanding of all Fortinet products, contracts and licensing Participate in the creation and improvement of Fortinet Customer policies, procedures and guidelines relating to Customer Service. Deliver the best quality in order to achieve high level of Customer Satisfaction. Take part in UAT testing. Develop good and respected relationships with internal and external customers by providing accurate, courteous and efficient service & support. Work with other staff in the department to meet the performance targets for efficiency, cost-effectiveness, productivity and quality that are above the average in the industry Be part of the on-call rotation of the team. Be flexible to work with the CS Managers on higher priority task and escalations Job Skill Required 3 years of customer service, support experience in an IT or Network Security Environment Fast-learner, flexible, and able to prioritize People-oriented with the ability to interact effectively with customers Strong problem analysis and problem-solving skills Multi-task oriented Fast typist Remains calm and professional under pressure or stress. Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision. Attention to detail and strong documentation skill Computer and network security experience Educational Requirements Relevant degree/diploma/certification and / or an equivalent combination of relevant training and experience is desirable. About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Job Description Fortinet is looking for a highly motivated individual to support our rapid growth by running a regional deals desk function for the Americas. The Deal Desk Analyst will be part of a larger Global Deal Desk organization and will intersect with Sales, Legal, Finance, Order Management, Supply Chain Management and work with our channel partners to ensure desirable outcomes for our end customers. In this role, you will be acting as a strategic advisor, managing deal flow, driving sustainable growth while minimizing sales cycle times and reducing risk. Fantastic collaboration skills are a must! Summary Of Job Responsibilities Partner with Sales and other regional/global deals desk to structure large, highly complex transactions, and deals with multi country deployments. Assist the sales leaders stay on top of margin/discounting guidance and provide updates on inventory changes. Act as a trusted advisor and the subject matter expert for the Americas region on how to execute global deployments effectively Develop subject matter expertise for geo specific country regulations, help the customer deployment stays within compliance and be able to create a consistent view for the end customer Train the sales teams on our process and tools, designed to make them successful in global engagements. Help build process and pricing consistency, share best practices. Work cross-functionally with internal customers and stakeholders for input. Interact and manage sales engagement activities across pricing, deal review, legal/contracts Work with stakeholders who manage daily quote approval process, non-standard deal requirements, etc. Work with channel teams and partners to get quotes for international customer deployments, help standardize quotes Sustain Field Sales accountability across deal life cycle requirements, help with expeditious deal approval, and assist the sales teams get over internal hurdles to close their deal. Develop and enhance documentation on deal structure, variances that may be particular in the GEO and produce training material and help deliver training. Required Skills Experience within Inside Sales, Channel Management or Deals Desk/Sales Ops. Ideally within the IT Industry – security and or networking sector Must be motivated, flexible and have a self-starter mentality High level of diligence in translating customer requirements and instructions into quotes SFDC/Salesforce.com knowledge would be an advantage Experience with Tableau or Clari would be an advantage Customer engagement skills a plus Excellent written and verbal communications skills Goal orientated and self-confident with the ability to work in a fast pace environment Able to work independently as well as part of a regional and global team Ability to direct stakeholders and hold peers accountable Ability to streamline, grow and manage a successful deal desk function Basic technical knowledge and understanding to be able to review customer proposals and quotes Bid Management and Proposal Creation Skills a Plus

Job Description Fortinet is expanding Deal Desk Function that goes beyond the current deal support or pricing support. The Deal Desk team makes a difference by providing a mechanism to support non-standard deal requests and helping sales navigate between various office functions. This allows Sales to focus on customer facing activities, while the Deals Desk helps coordinate interactions with internal teams as needed. The Deal Desk expert, LATAM will be responsible for collaborating very closely with the LATAM Field Sales Team, Sales Operations, Legal, Finance, Accounting and Product Management as well as other internal stakeholders to ensure that the Field Sales Teams have the support needed to achieve Organizational goals. Responsibilities In the Sales Finance organization, the Finance Deal Desk expert, LATAM partners with LATAM Sales to structure highly complex transactions, often with global deployments. Be a trusted finance business partner to the SVP of LATAM Sales and work closely with the sales leadership team in our Sunrise, Florida office Analyze sales deals for financial impact; Special pricing, Margin analysis, scenario analysis and deal structuring for revenue and gross margins Build business cases for investment accounts to gain Executive support and remain an active player throughout the sales cycle and exhibit professionalism. Develop quotes for Enterprise license agreements (ELA) and assist pricing team with proposals to large enterprise customers Support ad hoc reporting and financial projects; provide input and recommendations for streamlining processes and making process improvements Work cross-functionally with internal customers and stakeholders for input. Influence discount improvements through competitive intelligence and developing a subject matter expertise and to provide support where needed. Engage closely with Legal to support nonstandard commercial terms and conditions with proper approvals in place. Work with stakeholders who manage daily quote approval process, non-standard deal requirements, etc. Ensure compliance with published sales and business approval policies and serve as an escalation point to business leaders with proper rationale. Display senior level influence to gain organizational support for any necessary process, pricing and deal changes. Required Skills 12+ years’ experience in supporting global organizations; operating a finance deal desk role and/or Sales finance experience running contractual negotiations and a team responsible for contractual negotiation. Thorough understanding of all industry standard and non-standard hardware and software selling models, including subscription, SaaS, term, on demand, consumption and etc. Good understanding of revenue recognition requirements. Strong and active listening skills and overall communication skills, both written and verbal. Demonstrated ability and willingness to take initiative in owning, dealing with and resolving problems on a logical basis. Demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure, prioritize tasks and managing it well. Flexibility to adapt to constant change, detail oriented, thorough and responsive. Self-starter demonstrated ability to work independently in a team environment. Fluent in English and Spanish; MBA desired. Fortinet has been built on diversity. Our company is a diverse workplace resulting from an integrated team with true international representation and contributors with a variety of talents, backgrounds, experiences, and approaches. We have an equal and transparent selection process, you will be considered regardless of gender, race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, or disability. In fact, if you have any disability that requires for us to do any accommodation, please contact us at accommadations@fortinet.com.

Job Description Job Duties and Responsibilities Assist the sales leaders stay on top of margin/discounting guidance. Act as a trusted advisor and the subject matter expert for the LATAM region on how to execute global deployments effectively. Interact and manage sales engagement activities across pricing, deal review, legal/contracts. Work with channel teams, partners and distributors to get quotes for international customer deployment, help standardize quotes. Create opportunities and follow up on them through Distributors and partners until closed won. Forecasting and account/opportunity detail in Salesforce.com High-energy, motivated self-starter and team player. Ensure a seamless progression of deals through the sizing, quoting, billing and fulfillment stages while at times escalating non-standard pricing, discounts and logistical terms of approval. Qualifications (Education, Experience And Certifications) At least 3 years of experience managing comercial agreements/contracts. Self-driven and able to manage a diverse, high volume workload; ability to quickly build productive relationships in a fast-paced, high performance environment. Availability to travel: 10% of the time. Job Description Demand Generation Marketing Manager: We are looking for experienced rock star integrated marketer to join the Demand Generation Marketing team. Reporting to the Director, Demand Generation, this is a critical role on a growing team responsible for building and executing integrated enterprise marketing campaigns to drive marketing-sourced and influenced revenue. We’re looking for a marketer with a keen understanding of IT buyer behavior, B2B buyers/buying groups, and nuances of distinct personas. This marketer will have a deep knowledge of how to engage prospects and bring them through the buying process via multi-channel marketing campaigns. What Will You Do Conceptualize and execute compelling integrated marketing campaigns Own end-to-end execution of each program ensuring the right stakeholders are involved and deliver on time and budget Measure and optimize campaigns based on critical metrics like sourced and influenced pipeline and revenue Communicate effectively up and across teams to inform and make aware of campaigns and results (post launch) Coordinate effectively with cross-functional teams, including Demand Gen, Sales, Product Marketing, Corporate Marketing, Sales Enablement and outside agencies Build marketing plans that span across affiliate networks, paid acquisition, paid search, email, mobile, and onsite, among other traditional channels Work collaboratively with designers and copywriters, providing feedback and insights that help the team deliver on the campaign strategy Collaborate with internal stakeholders to translate campaign performance into reports including marketing briefs, competitive analyses, and campaign recap deck What You Bring To Fortinet 3-5 years of experience in integrated marketing Experience aligning on strategic direction and supporting global promotional strategy that requires input from multiple teams Able to draw insights from data and create compelling campaigns that align with company goals A good balance of creative, strategic and operational thinking Proven ability to execute and deliver projects successfully in a dynamic fast paced environment Strong knowledge of SalesForce reporting and experience with Pardot or Eloqua Experience with WorkFront helpful Detail-oriented with outstanding organizational skills Strong writing and verbal communication skills Able to jump between strategy and hands-on execution seamlessly Solid analytical skills

Job Description Director, Federal Compliance Officer Role Overview Fortinet, a global leader in cybersecurity, is recruiting a Federal Compliance Officer to join our Legal and Government Affairs team to manage compliance and security matters related to sales to the United States Government. The position will report to Fortinet’s Head of Government Affairs. This Role Will Manage Priorities Related To Job Duties/Responsibilities: Adherence to statutory, regulatory, and legal requirements related to federal procurement opportunities, including application of FAR and DFAR provisions to Fortinet, Inc. The establishment and ongoing management of compliance policies Collaborating with the Fortinet Federal sales and marketing team to position the Fortinet brand, capabilities, and offerings Training internal stakeholders of government programs, national security requirements, and related reporting/disclosures Partnering across key Fortinet business units including teams focused on information security, supply chain risk management, product management, contract manufacturer engagement, research and development, human resources, and legal Identifying and analyzing regulatory and legislative policy proposals’ impact to the company Further build collaborative relationships with federal agencies on national security matters Requirements Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in a related field; Master’s degree or law degree preferred 15+ years of relevant national security and project management experience, and ideally experience with cybersecurity, technology, and communications solutions and policies. Experience working with internal product, research and development, and information security teams. Solid understanding of public policy, the policymaking process, with ability to help translate these efforts to the broader Fortinet team Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong interpersonal skills, with an ability to establish positive relationships with key officials High integrity and a good understanding of the ethical rules and laws applicable to government affairs and public sector engagement Proven ability to establish plans and objectives, and then execute in an intelligent, cost effective, and strategic way Organized and self-motivated, ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
location: Washington, Distrito de Columbia, Estados Unidos

jobDescription: Job Description Director, Government Affairs Role Overview Fortinet, a global leader in cybersecurity, is recruiting a Director/Policy Counsel, Government Affairs to join our Government Affairs team to accelerate Fortinet’s Government Affairs strategy and engagement. The position will report to Fortinet’s Head of Government Affairs. Job Duties This role will further develop and execute upon government-focused priorities and strategy around: Growing broad, longstanding relationships with key federal and state governmental representatives Collaborating with the global sales and marketing team to help promote and position the Fortinet brand, capabilities, and offerings Educating internal stakeholders of government programs, policies, and funding opportunities important to expanding network security Policy stewardship focused on the cross-sector reach of network security needs critical to the business such as OT, healthcare, education, energy, and infrastructure Establishing a cooperative relationship between Fortinet’s security experts and government representatives Responsibilities Help grow the global government affairs program and drive it to contribute to the overall business in meaningful, tangible ways Establish and/or maintain effective, trusted, and long-lasting relationships with key Federal government agencies across the cybersecurity and critical infrastructure fields Expand Fortinet’s participation in federal, state, and international public-sector related programs, certification processes, and procurement processes Help ensure strong recognition of Fortinet’s capabilities by policymakers to ensure Fortinet security experts are positioned to support and advise key government officials on cybersecurity and network security matters Represent Fortinet before cross-sector industry coalitions, associations, and other third-party organizations Work collaboratively with the Fortinet Government Affairs team to craft and execute a strategy that supports and achieves business goals and strategic objectives across the US and select international countries Identify opportunities for strategic engagement in policy discussions and participate in the drafting of government related documents including legislative proposals, agency filings, and thought leadership pieces Craft political engagement strategy and manage related internal educational and compliance requirements Requirements Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in a related field; Master’s degree or law degree preferred 8+ years of relevant experience including government affairs experience, and ideally experience with cybersecurity, technology, and communications solutions and policies. Objective Job Description We are looking for a Director Product Marketing Manager to join our dynamic Fortinet team. This is an exciting opportunity to work with the company’s flagship FortiGate product line and other specialized security product lines. It will play a critical role in contributing to the successful product development, management, launches and long term sales and revenue generation goals. The successful candidate will have opportunities to drive cross functional teams and develop strong relationships with the sales team to create compelling tools, platforms and messaging. Responsibilities Create and implement product marketing content, including white papers, brochures, data sheets, solutions guides. Articulate benefits, via marketing collateral and in-person meetings, to Fortinet enterprise customers, channel partners and MSSP customers. Manage product portfolio and drive strong interlock with the PM Teams to drive new innovations Perform product price analysis and be a consultant to the executive team Support R&D with market analysis for new initiatives and products Develop product positioning and competitive analysis to support Fortinet sales and channel partners Develop reseller partner focused plans to enable growth in channel markets by working closely with Channel sales and marketing teams Coordinate launch initiatives with PR/AR/IR and act as spokesperson for product Lead cross-department product teams to launch products Support related activities owned by other groups (case studies, references, trade shows, events, technical white papers, SE training, etc.) Collaborate with alliance partners and services to offer complete solutions Interface and partner effectively with the product management team Required Skills 5+ years of experience with security technologies 5+ years of product marketing experience Strong technology background network security, i.e. Next Generation Firewall, SD-WAN, IPS/IDS and Network Segmentation Preferred experience in especially in Large Campus and Data-Center networking and security Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong product management and analytical skills preferred. Ability to work both independently and across functional teams. Ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization, including remote areas. Ability to function well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with competing priorities. Education  Bachelor’s degree, master’s degree , MBA preferred
