Job Description Enterprise Agreement Marketing Manager (US) Fortinet’s Enterprise Agreement Program is growing rapidly and becoming the primary basis for doing business with our largest accounts. The Enterprise Agreement (EA) program simplifies the relationship between Fortinet and its larger customers, making it easier for customers to deploy and manage their growing Fortinet estates and add new layers of security to realize the Fortinet Security Fabric vision. We are looking for an energetic and experienced pricing, licensing, and deal support expert to join our EA team and help us manage and grow our Enterprise Agreement (EA) program in US. Job Title: Enterprise Agreement Marketing Manager Job Description Financial analysis Model complex pricing and licensing programs to determine appropriate pricing levels, acceptable discounts, and expected margins. Analyze and construct unique/customized agreements to fit customers’ service and subscription needs. Construct financial analysis for end customer presentations Sales Support for Enterprise Agreement opportunities Partner with sales teams to construct EA’s terms and conditions for Enterprise customers; attention to details is key to produce orderable quotes Collaborate with Finance to evaluate and approve discount requests and margins on Enterprise Agreement opportunities Market, promote and sales support of the program to customers and partners; timely and attentive response is key Cross-functional leadership Collaborate with key Sales, Marketing, Legal, IT, Finance stakeholders to help with complex, nonstandard proposals and approvals Create and implement any new offerings in the program from pricing to SKU setup to post sales customer experience Sales Enablement Develop marketing and training assets for Sales to use with customers, on our website, or internally to train Fortinet sales representatives and key channel partners. Competitive research and positioning Perform research on other vendor programs, and help Sales position Fortinet offerings to win. New offer development Assist with new offer and collateral development Experience 6+ years of experience being responsible for pricing and licensing of subscriptions, software, hardware, support, etc. Strong knowledge of Enterprise Agreement and have worked on defining/managing/selling EAs to large customers. Background in IT Security pricing a big plus. Advanced knowledge and use of Excel is necessary. Kn owledge and use of PowerPoint and Word is also required. Education – MBA preferred, with a Finance and/or Marketing emphasis Position Reports To: Director, Enterprise Agreement Program (in the Marketing organization). Location: United States. Some WFH will be permitted. Travel: Many meetings can be held remotely, but occasional travel may be required depending on the Sales/Customer situation (~10-15%). Local governmental pandemic-related guidelines regarding essential travel will be respected.

Job Description Be an active part of a Team of highly skilled and technical Enterprise Architects that will work with Fortinet’s top tier enterprise accounts to create a differentiated level of support and engagement. Team shall deliver a service that presents the customer with a concierge type engagement delivering a high touch white glove service and relationship. Team will engage with the customer at a very high level providing oversight of in progress projects, assessing general conditions related to services Fortinet is delivering, and engaging with Customer Account Team in strategic discussion around customer needs and desires, all with the goal of making sure the customer is very satisfied and that Fortinet is delivering on committed solutions. This role will meet clear benchmarks for measurements around progress and satisfaction are achieved, as well as making sure the desired level of relationship within the assigned accounts are met, and that the desired white glove service is being delivered. Customer satisfaction scoring and feedback is the ultimate measurement for success in this role. Position Overview Job Duties Enterprise Architecture Team members should have the following characteristics at a minimum; Deep technical knowledge and experience with the bulk of Fortinet Core Products Have excellent communication skills both oral and written Embody a mentality and demeanor of “at your service” concierge style attitude Understand and demonstrate superb ambassadorship skills Be able to present technical concepts, network architecture designs, and security related topics with all levels of customer contacts including C-Level Executives. Be deeply involved with day-to-day operational aspects of customer projects and Fortinet teams working in the accounts. Effectively apply Fortinet’s methodology and re-enforces project and engagement standards. Help to protect and minimize Fortinet’s exposure and risk on projects and relationships. Work closely with all customer-facing Fortinet functions, including sales, operations, product management, support and others to coordinate activities. Work to promote a relationship 100% in lock step with the Field Sales Account Management team. Actions like weekly calls with account teams for progress, challenges, ensuring who has ownership for specific tasks, not duplicating efforts or creating confusion with customer, etc. Notify and escalate to the proper organizations and leadership teams if conditions at an account start to deteriorate in order to avoid issues achieving critical mass. Work with team members as they facilitates PS, Presales & SE team and client meetings effectively. Effectively communicates relevant project information to Team management. Work to resolve and/or escalates issues in a timely fashion. Help supporting teams understand how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully Highlight areas of improvement and recommend changes in methods, processes and tools. Monitor operational and customer satisfaction metrics to meet organizational goals. Handle project escalations and follow up on customer satisfaction surveys. Build and maintain strong relationships with the sales teams. Align customer and Fortinet strategies, to proactively avoid potential issues in any of the pre-sales processes established. Provide feedback and follow up to processes refinement, helping to establish the right cadence, process, and follow-through. Job Experience / Abilities Required Excellent conflict resolution skills Ability to think creatively to develop new solutions to problems. Ability to create a vision, establish a plan, and ensure plan execution through success. Ability to coach others. Experience in a Professional Services role in a networking/security company or equivalent education. Demonstrated leadership skills. Full knowledge of all relevant Fortinet business policies and practices. Technical and strategic planning and road map presentation skills Highly organized and able to juggle multiple projects simultaneously Great relationship building skills Deep technical knowledge on Fortinet Solutions and Internet security. Adaptable and flexible, operating in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Ability to work and take quick decisions under pressure. Willing to travel around 25% of the time. Job Description In this key role, you will manage and drive direct sales engagements into the Federal Government and strategic Partners. Your focus will be to create and implement strategic account plans focused on attaining deployments of Fortinet products and services. Develop executive relationships with key buyers and influencers and leverage these during the sales process. Coordinate with appropriate internal groups to generate and deliver winning Contract Bids, Proposals, RFI/RFP Responses, and Statements of Work. Negotiate terms of business with clients to achieve win/win results that provide the basis for strong ongoing relationships. Objective In this key role, you will manage and drive direct sales engagements into the Federal Government and strategic Partners. About The Job We are looking to hire a top-tier finance leader for a Finance Director position, who will work as a key member in the FP&A team and provide finance partnership cross-functionally to formulate and achieve our strategic and financial goals. You will play a critical role in preparing proactive reporting and analysis of key performance measurement indicator and help build a strong FP&A organization that enables our continued hypergrowth. The ideal candidate will have a successfully track record of effective business partnership and outstanding financial reporting/modeling skills. Responsibilities Lead business planning, analytics, and reporting primarily for the Sales organization, and drive monthly, quarterly and annual financial planning and forecasting cycles Support revenue forecasts and related analyses, providing visibility and helping to define key topline metrics. Perform in-depth, comprehensive financial analysis, including extracting insights from data/ analyses, identifying drivers and implications, and translating findings into practical recommendations. Develop solid cadence in reporting insightful business metrics. Build rigor round data hygiene, ensure integrity, accuracy and consistency in reporting and leverage the power of data to educate and engage business owners and finance peers. Partner with cross functional groups to drive enhancements and improve data infrastructure Implement and drive efficient, effective and comprehensive process and procedures to allow faster and scalable planning and forecast cycle. Responsible for financial model development to support and enable business decisions. Help to hire, develop and retain an impactful team of A-players and build a strong FP&A organization Lead strategy projects and ad hoc requests Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent practical experience; Advanced degree preferred 15+ years of relevant work experience in the fields of financial planning and analysis, corporate finance, or accounting Superior analytical and modeling capacities Outstanding software and system skills with extensive experience in Hyperion Cloud, Oracle Financial Applications and Tableau Must be detail oriented to ensure accuracy and quality of output Must be flexible in job assignments Preferred Qualifications Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities Ability to think strategically and operate effectively with the Management team and other business partners Self-motivated and comfortable managing shifting priorities, achieving effective results within tight deadlines, and working across diverse & fast-paced assignments Ability to provide driving metrics and reporting for enhanced business monitoring & growth visibility Analytical mindset who can also focus on the big picture Experience designing and scaling processes that support a fast growth business environment Strong communicator

Job Description GL Manager We are seeking a motivated, experienced, well-rounded GL Manager. This is a newly created position due to company growth. This position requires an organized, technically proficient accounting manager with an analytical mind and the ability to lead. The GL Manager will be responsible for reviewing a wide range of accounting activities including monthly GL entries and account reconciliations, preparing or reviewing schedules and analyses for internal and external reporting purposes, and ensure a smooth accounting process monthly. The role will also involve collaborating with cross-functional teams. The GL Manager role will report to the Sr. Manager of Accounting. Functions & Responsibilities Manage month-end close including, but not limited to, reviewing journal entries and GL account reconciliations for the areas including Prepaid & other assets, and reviewing Fixed Assets and Evaluation unit transactions weekly throughout the month to ensure FAM close on time. Responsible for Open PO Accruals, General Accruals, Deferred Cogs, Allocations JEs & Recons Review and prepare monthly variance analysis of balance sheet and income statement accounts for management review Assist in quarterly reviews and annual audit with external auditors, prepare PBC Schedules Assist in SOX Audit and fulfill SOX Compliance requirements quarterly Manage annual Fixed Assets Count project, prepare WW FA Count Sheets for all regions, coordinate with all region teams to perform FA Count, review and summarize FA count results Coordinate with other departments to obtain transaction information, research reconciling items, and resolve issues Ad-hoc process improvement projects and management inquiries whenever needed Abilities & Competencies BS in Accounting, 5+ years’ accounting management experience, including 2-3 years Fixed Assets Management experience, and 10+ years’ minimum progressive experience in Accounting roles Large public company accounting team experience required Experience with Oracle R12 or similar global ERP system required such as SAP, familiar with ARCS system or similar Account Reconciliation system preferred Strong familiarity with common accounting issues, financial statement line items and financial metrics/ratios Strong analytical skills, creative problem-solving, and ability to summarize conclusions succinctly Flexibility and comfort with continuous change, willingness to take on challenges Ability to prioritize multiple duties and work independently Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to actively and attentively listen High degree of dedication to improvement and strong sense of ownership Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Knowledge of Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.

Job Description Fortinet seeks a passionate Client Executive (CE), that will be the trusted advisor to senior decision makers in your assigned Enterprise client and will translate the customers’ business needs, into opportunities. The CE will be responsible for orchestrating the short & long-term strategic approach for their customers, whilst collaboratively harnessing all necessary resources, to achieve the objectives of both the customer, and Fortinet. Simply put, the Client Executive is responsible for orchestrating the activities required to transform Fortinet’s relationship with their client to one that is seen as a mutual strategic partnership. Responsibilities You will be assigned a strategic global enterprise account requiring global execution with a high level of complexity, carrying significant strategic importance to Fortinet. You will identify and validate customer priorities, business drivers, and outcomes. You will put in place a global strategy that drives all Fortinet activities, and leverages a multifunctional global team of Fortinet resources. You will Establish a personal and professional brand as the trusted partner for your client. Influence decision makers and gain “insider status” with key stakeholders and senior/CxO profiles to influence the customer’s buying process. Lead the development of wide and deep relationships across all strategic functions with your selected client. You will put in place a services strategy that sets Fortinet up with the right service delivery to support the customer success agenda, adoption, and future growth You will translate your client’s business needs into Fortinet solutions and be able to position associated value add and business impact. Anticipate customer needs, beyond the existing scope of products & services, to discover opportunities that position the total value of the entire breadth of the Fortinet portfolio. You will be responsible for overall account strategic relevance, revenue growth, profitability, forecast governance, performance objectives and customer NPS across Fortinet. Requirements You will bring +5 years of experience leading global major account sales and teams. You have broad knowledge of IT-industry, product lines, geographical region, marketing, sales and business strategy You bring demonstrable experience selling complex technical solutions to executive management. You are able to set and communicate strategy and goals, whilst motivating others to contribute and deliver You possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, able to build rapport and communicate effectively at all levels, and across disciplines using different communication techniques You are change orientated, able to accept work with and manage an ever-changing work environment You are a natural team worker, working effectively within the team delivering own targets and supporting others You are proactive - anticipate change, future needs or risk in the business or areas of responsibility and comfortable in proposing appropriate activities to meet these challenges. Job Description Overview: Responsible for all aspects of the product design/development cycle, including definition, implementation, management and release to manufacturing of high speed networking security boards and systems. Responsibilities Ability to implement, integrate and debug different platforms in all technical aspects within the discipline schedule. Must have a good communication skill to manage the vendors (CM, JDM, OEM) on all aspects of the design to maximize the result. A great problem solver, debugger, and willing to take calculated risk to drive result. Have an open mind and can do attitude. Job Description Inside Sales Intern (Spring 2023) Fortinet is one of the world’s leaders in all things cybersecurity and we’re looking for great people to join our growing team! We're recruiting three (3) Inside Sales Interns to join our Spring 2023 Internship & Early Talent program. In this role, you'll be working with inside sales management focused on reporting and performance metrics. You'll be exposed to nearly every aspect of inside sales and gain a keen understanding of what a career in sales management looks like in real life. Besides working on impactful projects, you will also participate in lunch and learn sessions with our executives, networking activities, and project showcases. This is a hybrid role based out of any of our office locations including: Frisco, TX; New York, New York; Sunnyvale, CA; Boston, MA; Sunrise, FL; Chicago, IL. Responsibilities Assist ISR Managers with weekly reports, data collection, and KPI measurement. Learn to create Salseforce.com reports and dashboards to support performance management. Participate in planning team meetings and cultural events. About You Self-motivated, a problem solver, and enthusiastic "can-do" attitude with a passion for learning and growing. You are a leader and excellent teammate with experience in a collaborative team environment. Qualifications Currently a senior enrolled in a four-year degree program in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field with an expected graduation date of Summer or Winter 2023. Must able to demonstrate strong knowledge with MS Suite, communication, speaking, and writing skills. Job Description Position: Inside Systems Engineer Objective We are looking for an Inside Systems Engineer to work closely with our SMB channel sales team responsible for covering the US based SMB Partners. The Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales organization in all technical matters regarding pre-sales, sales calls, and Partner training Responsibilities Pre-sales - assist in qualifying sales leads from a technical standpoint. Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer/ educate the customer and partner on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Conversant with networking applications and solutions. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Provide sales and technical training for new and existing Partners Remotely assist new Partner engineers with customer evaluations and product testing Deliver regular webex sessions geared toward partner recruitment and continuing education Required Skills 3+ years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer 3+ years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Strong understanding of the firewall market to include Firewall, IPS, Web Filtering, Application Control, and Email security Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Education Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. Job Description In this key role, you will manage, direct and drive Systems Engineers assigned to Public Sector Accounts in your assigned region. Create and implement strategic plans focused on attaining enterprise-wide deployments of Fortinet products and services. Develop executive relationships with key buyers and influencers in Major accounts and leverage these relationships. Coordinate with appropriate internal groups to generate and deliver winning Contract Bids, Proposals, RFI/RFP Responses, and Statements of Work. Negotiate terms of business with clients to achieve win/win results that provide the basis for strong ongoing relationships. Responsibilities Manage and motivate a team of System Engineers focused on Public Sector Accounts Develop technical account plans to achieve goals and exceed quota responsibility Maximize Fortinet opportunity while providing value added solutions to Enterprise customers Serve as the main technical resource on sales calls and answer/ educate the customer on issues ranging from features, specifications, and functionality to integration. Works closely together with the Systems Engineers and Account Managers in order to maximize the primary business focus and serves as team leader responsible for the quality and success of Technical resources in the Public Sector Accounts Develops relationships with key decision makers, influencers, and partners Manages effective working relationships with assigned region MAMs, Technical Sales Engineers, and Consulting Professionals Travels within assigned territory is required Required Skills 5 – 8 years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineering manager 5 - 7 years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Excellent presentation skills to executives & individual contributors Excellent written and verbal communication skills A self-motivated, independent thinker that can move deals through the selling cycle Preferred Skills & Experience Knowledge of E-Rate funding and response process. Experience and knowledge of public funding programs for technology. Working knowledge of public compliance and regulatory requirements such as CIPA, FIPS, and others. Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in network security industry. Job Description This is a newly created position to help meet the IT needs of Fortinet’s rapidly growing workforce. With over 10,000 people worldwide (and growing) and the implementation of new IT systems, we are looking for a mid-level Network Administrator to help us ensure 24x7 network support. In this critical role you will be based in our Sunnyvale Headquarters and support our global distribution of network and server systems. This is an excellent opportunity to join a network security company and utilize the latest systems and equipment to support our network availability. Responsibilities Deliver network implementation and remediation projects to meet demands Identify, diagnose and resolve network problem, analyze root cause Install, maintains and upgrade network hardware, software, and operating systems Reporting network operational status by gathering, prioritizing information Securing network system by establishing and enforcing policies, and defining and monitoring access Maximizing network performance by monitoring performance, troubleshooting network problem and outages Coordinates and communicates with users Responds to and resolves support requests Participate in an on-call rotation for support of systems outside of normal business hours Skills And Requirements 5+ years of experience in network administration Certifications in one or more of the following: CCNP and CCNA, Fortinet certification a plus Comprehensive understanding of networking hardware and infrastructure Experience in troubleshooting network problems Strong L2/L3 switching experience and knowledge Extensive knowledge with routing protocols including OSPF, and BGP Experience managing MPLS, IPSec VPN encryption platforms and policies Expert knowledge TCP/IP, IPv4/IPv6, DNS, DHCP, operation systems and applications data flows Expertise in firewall platforms, network security such as AV, IPS, DLP Experience on Wifi and VoIP a plus Hands-on experience supporting networking in 24 x 7 enterprise environments Strong multi-tasking abilities Demonstrated ability to work under pressure Excellent English oral and written communications skills Education BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering (or equivalent education and experience) About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Job Description The Burn-in Test Development Department develops Burn-in test programs to support Burn-in test/QC test, which supports all products ready for release and shipping. This department also develops test programs for NPI (New Product Introduction) test, which is used for testing new platform designs, prior to production. Responsibilities QA test on Burn-in test program itself, make sure test program is stable/functional, maintenance test doc. Setting up environment, performing debug testing, reproducing and verification with different product model R&D developer team. Perform NPI QC testing on FGT model with Burn-in test program. Designing and writing new test case, test specification, for new NPI device model, to confirm whatever hardware/software/firmware of product are good. Support on Burn-in test program maintenance for various model and different team. Requirements Experience with Linux and shell script programming, Experience with programming or scripting skills (Python, VB Script, Robot Framework, etc.) Good knowledge of TCP/IP, routing and switching protocols Familiar with databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL). Familiar with front-end languages and libraries (JavaScript, Vue, etc.) is a plus With hardworking spirit and teamwork skill, ability to multitask and quickly react to system/service issues. Highly motivated and responsible, quick learner and self-starter. Job Description Fortinet, a leading Silicon Valley cybersecurity company, is recruiting a Legal & Corporate Development Intern for the Early Talent Program next Summer 2023. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual to take the initiative, is self-motivated and a quick learner, and wants to gain broad experience supporting the in-house Legal department for a successful Silicon Valley technology company that is determined to maintain its entrepreneurial, fast-paced roots and yet is large enough to be international and stable. The intern will get to work on an impactful project, and participate in multiple lunch and learn session with our executives, networking activities, and project showcasing during the internship. If you are looking for a career in a high-energy, professional work environment at a company that values and rewards your contributions, challenges you to shape your own career path, and provides top-notch personal development, then we want to hear from you! Position Description Provide services in high quality, efficient, and service-oriented manner for specified businesses within Fortinet US. Additionally, the successful candidate will gain valuable business experience related to an in-house legal team by working with a global team of seasoned attorneys and professionals on various legal matters. Job Description Position: Major Account Manager, Enterprise www.fortinet.com Objective In this key role, you will manage and drive direct sales into Major Enterprise Accounts. Job Description Manager – Partner Services Enablement Location: USA Language/s: Fluent English, Spanish Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) is growing and we are expanding our Global services & support teams. We are looking for an experienced manager to implement and deploy partner support and services programs in AMER region. As networks and threats rapidly evolve, it’s critical to make sure our customer’s security capabilities keep up. The Engage services programs allow our partners to deepen their customer relationships, expertly deploy, operate, and maintain security solutions that protect their customers’ investments. Key Responsibilities: Seeking innovative and strategic Partner Success Manager to build strong relationships with business partners and offer best in class services to customers. Cultivate successful and trusted relationships with Channel account managers and selected services partners. Effectively manage and enable partners to execute Fortinet product implementations for enterprise customers across industries globally Take ownership and accountability of service delivery assurance including requirements, design, quality assurance, deployment activities, customer & partner relationship, planning, various milestones and financials. Conceptualize and formulate best of breed solutions that effectively address key implementation objectives within the bounds of scope, schedule and efforts. Contribute to the product and services road-map through active feedback from customers, partners and implementation experience. Maintain effective relationships internally with all functions and drive change management considering interests and impact of all stakeholders. Be a SPOC for partners to reach out to in Fortinet and provide robust & personalized implementation support throughout the program life-cycle. Champion company policies and processes, and ensure their adherence within the team. Facilitate interaction, manage inter-dependencies and conflict resolution among all functional teams globally. Communicate the key elements of the support and services programs and guide partners through the Partner Enablement phases of the Services Partner life-cycle. Build product and consulting services knowledge of Fortinet offerings as well as continuously develop partnership skills. Ramp up new partners through partner education, training and effective on-boarding. Implement partner performance management framework development and evaluations. Recommend initiatives to improve the overall program performance. Skills And Attributes Requirements 10 years + program management and technical background, with understanding of security and internetworking skills. Exceptional organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills. Good negotiation, oral communication and presentation skills. Experience working with global enterprise and carrier. Demonstrated experience in personnel management. Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities. Flexible during times of change. Ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources Self-driven individual. Educational And Experience Requirements Educated to degree level in sales administration or business administration discipline and/or extensive experience in program management operating in similar role Fluent English (written and spoken), Spanish and Portuguese are an advantage Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office and other role based software tools PMI / PRINCE II / ITIL certification is a plus Ability to set personal objectives being self-driven for achievement and motivation

Job Description Marketing Operations Manager Fortinet secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network—today and into the future. The Marketing Operations team at Fortinet enables strategy development and successful execution of the Fortinet go-to-market by continuously innovating on data and marketing strategy and technology decisions to drive business outcomes. We are looking to add a Marketing Operations Manager who will further strengthen the team to ensure sustained growth and scaling of our business targets and results. Responsibilities For This Role Would Include Lead thought process in business KPI definitions and develop measurements to drive marketing contribution to business results. Understanding existing processes to bring lead data from various incoming streams (events, webinars etc.) lead data ingestion into our marketing systems and creating infrastructure components needed to automate this process. Continuously improve prospect profile and engagement by improving methods to measure lead quality pertinent to our business both from the prospect/marketing audience persona/profile perspective and from a marketing engagement perspective for our target audience. Align target audience with business goals and drive sourcing and maintenance of target audience data in our Marketing Automation, CRM, data orchestration, intent and other platforms. Define and build analytical dashboards and data summaries to measure prospect buying journey including engagement summaries and progress towards business results such as opportunities and bookings. Implement automation to reduce amount of time and effort needed to perform various audience segmentations and micro-segmentation to support a multitude of marketing campaigns with a rich portfolio of products, services, and route-to-market strategies. Support adjacent marketing business functions and sales as needed to drive overall success for the business. Successful candidates expected to have experience in sales operations, marketing and data analytics along with 8+ years of proven track record improving marketing technologies, automation, data standardization, data transformation, and business intelligence/analytics to deliver significant business outcomes. Bachelor’s degree in business or technology and master’s degree in business or analytics are a plus; must be a data-driven marketing strategy and execution practitioner. Must have ability to learn and leverage new data orchestration and analytics platforms to synthesize meaningful, actionable insights towards business outcomes and drive marketing data quality. Tableau dashboard development expertise and SalesForce reporting/dashboard development expertise are must have prerequisites.

Job Description We are looking for an experienced Sales Representative to focus on Higher Education. The ideal candidate has sales experience in this vertical with a terrific reputation for overachieving quota while focusing on the customer. They should also be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on quarterly revenue targets. The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical background that enables them to drive an engagement at the CXO level as well as with Network & Security Engineers and IT architects. The Enterprise Sales Representative will be an exceptionally strong and creative thinker who thrives in a team environment and embraces all aspects of selling. They will must be able to work in fast-paced, dynamic environment and have very strong verbal and written communication skills. Experience working with administrators, researchers, and faculty for the benefit for students is very desirable. Job Description In this key role, you will manage and drive direct sales engagements into Local Government Accounts / Agencies. Your focus will be to create and implement strategic account plans focused on attaining County and Local Government agency-wide deployments of Fortinet products and services. Job Description Are you the next FORTIHIRE? Fortinet Teams are looking for NEW GRADS of 2022 for a variety of skill domains such as Software Development Engineers Embedded Software Engineers Web Developers Software Dev QA Engineers DevOps Engineers Hardware Engineers ...and more We would like to invite NEW GRADs to register by applying to this posting and uploading your resume so that our HR team is able to review your profile. Please note that this posting is specifically meant for new graduates only who have recently graduated and those who are about to graduate and available for full time opportunities between now and the remainder of 2022. Whether you are interested in a Software developer role or QA or C Programmer or Web Developer or Hardware Engineer, we encourage you to apply here. Please be advised that this is a general application form - We will carefully review your application and contact you via email or phone if we have a suitable position available. We also encourage NEW GRADs of 2022 to check out and keep an eye on our specific job postings and apply to them as you see fit - These are the specific roles we currently have open and will consider new graduates for. For experienced candidates, there are postings available on our careers page where they can register and apply for other openings. The Sunnyvale R&D location is our Head Office and one of our core technology hub with experts in the Engineering field. Our salaries are competitive and we also offer Stock grants/Stock options in addition to a great benefits package. In addition, you will learn more about the cyber and network security landscape with great career progression opportunities and the ability to move into different teams at Fortinet. With the ever growing global demand to secure networks in the face of emerging new threats and data breaches, there is a greater need to provide end-to-end, next generation Security products for integrated and customized solutions to secure enterprises on different scales. The Network/Cyber Security Industry is poised to grow from 75 Billion (current) to 175 Billion Dollar industry by 2020. If you are up for a challenge and a career in our Industry, Fortinet is at the forefront and offers you the opportunity to get a dream start to your career! Thank you in advance for your application! #GD About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses.

Job Description Operational Technology Director Job Description For more than a decade, Fortinet has protected industrial networks in Operational Technology (OT) environments in sectors such as oil & gas, power & utilities, defense, manufacturing, food and transportation. By designing security into complex infrastructure via the Fortinet Security Fabric, organizations have an efficient, non-disruptive way to ensure that the OT environment is protected and compliant. As a key member of Fortinet’s Operational Technology team, you will create, manage and drive revenue generating activities with internal sales, engineering teams and Partners on Fortinet’s OT go-to-market strategy. Responsibilities Sales – Assist the team as an overlay resource across Operational Technology opportunities in our Commercial and Enterprise territories to achieve quarterly sales goals Translate – Build the bridge between business needs and technology requirements Advise – Act as trusted advisor on OT and or Converged IT OT solution needs across multiple verticals with Director, C-Level and VP-Level executives Discover – Find opportunities to upsell and cross-sell Fortinet solutions into customer accounts Present – Speak at different technology focused meetings, industry events and customer sites Required Skills Experience selling industrial and automation hardware and software platforms Proven ability to sell multi-product solutions A proven track record of quota achievement and demonstrated career stability Excellent presentation skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Competitive, self-motivated and independent thinker that can help move deals through the selling cycle 10+ years of experience in outside selling into industrial operational technology environments 10+ years of experience selling security, network and or software solutions Ability to travel 30-40% Education Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

Job Description Paid Search Manager Company Description Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) is seeking a Paid Search Manager to join our rapidly growing demand generation marketing team. This team is a fast-paced team charged with growing the business through driving qualified prospects to various Fortinet properties to generate marking qualified leads and pipeline while continuing to build brand awareness. Job Description The Paid Search Manager is tasked with the day-to-day management of global search programs and will partner with cross functional teams to collaborate on campaign launches and prioritizations. This role is expected to manage planning, execution, and reporting for paid search efforts and collaborate with the SEO team to ensure coverage for all strategic growth initiatives. Responsibilities Own day-to-day execution of the global paid search strategy and budget management Work cross-functionally with campaigns and demand gen managers to build strategies in conjunction with new campaign launches Provide budget, keyword, and ad copy recommendations for campaigns Work with regional teams for ad copy and campaign translations as needed Report on key KPI metrics and provide campaign insights and recommended optimizations Create, execute, and report on quarterly testing plans Ability to plan and manage YouTube video campaigns Required Qualifications 3-5 years of experience managing paid search campaigns in Google and Bing Proven success driving MQLs from PPC The ability to build actionable reporting across segmentation, performance, and operational metrics. A deep understanding of the Google landscape and how search fits into the overall media mix Excellent communication skills Strong Microsoft Excel skills Desired Qualifications Google Ads SEM Certification Bonus is familiar with tools such as SiteImprove

Job Description We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled senior Platform Engineer with 9+ years of experience to manage our development and QA lab environment at Fortinet. Our product is based on micro-services architecture, and we provide security in virtualized environments, both on-prem as well as on the cloud platforms. In this role we are expecting knowledge of DevOps tools, strong background in Linux system administration and knowledge in networking and server grade hardware. Required A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Software Engineering Comfortable with advanced shell scripting. Linux admin knowledge. We expect the candidate to maintain services like bind(DNS), ntp, dhcp/bootp and then IPv4/IPv6/Bonding changes etc Proficient in python programming. Have a good understanding of Makefile Excellent knowledge of Jenkins/git , especially Jenkins pipelines and Groovy programming. Hardware hands on knowledge. Changing disks, diagnose system failures, flash firmware Maintain switches(fan replacements) and wiring... Have a good understanding of VSphere/VMware technology Knowledge on a VLAN level is pretty much a must here along the switches.. Bonus if you know how to upgrade and maintain a box on ESX CLI level. Bonus Knowledge: Veeam, QNAP, KVM/Qemu, Dell/HP Hardware, Cisco/Netgear/HPE Switches Fortinet product knowledge Windows Admin Knowledge User maintenance, along DNS configuration etc. Lower level block device usage on linux(parted/dmsetup/luks) Knowledgeable in Docker (vxlan/overlay/swarm/etc) technologies Certifications in one or more of the above technologies is a plus. #GD About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Job Description We are looking for a Regional Systems Engineer to work closely with a sales representative in a defined territory. The Regional Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales organization in all technical matters regarding pre-sales, sales calls, and post-sales. Responsibilities: Pre-sales - assist in qualifying sales leads from a technical standpoint. Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer/ educate the customer on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Conversant with networking applications and solutions. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Provide assistance to identified customers with post-sales training. Required Skills: 5 – 8 years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer 5 - 7 years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration 5 - 7 years of experience with Wireless technologies, deploying, supporting and doing site surveys. Strong understanding of Wireless Authentication technologies Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Fluent in English

Job Description The Global Operations Team is looking to add a Pricing Analyst to work execute pricing decisions across our broad portfolios. Job Description Work with product management and product marketing teams, as well as finance team to explain, summarize and execute pricing decisions on price lists across Fortinet’s broad portfolio, including our leading hardware appliances, software products, cloud offerings, and other services. Manage requests and inquiries coming in to the Pricing team, document and track all requests and resolutions. Provide pricing analytical support relating to any tactical price change request. Work with cross-functional teams on integrating pricing and pricelist information with various systems to ensure that we maintain accurate product and pricing information throughout the organization. This may involve spreadsheets, databases, CRM and ERP systems like SFDC and Oracle. Responsible for co-developing and managing a pricing app and pricelist automation tools and calculators. Perform as the key contact of the automation project. This will involve communication with system engineers on specifications, data validation and auditing, data import and export and system testing. Review existing pricing methodologies and recommend changes, where appropriate. Work with Product Management and Product Marketing teams to build knowledge of Fortinet’s broad product set and product roadmaps, to understand and influence future pricing decisions. Create sales enablement materials and train sales team on pricing tools and other pricing topics Requirements Bachelor’s Degree required, Accounting/Finance degree a plus. 4+ years minimum of experience in pricing operations, pricing strategy, financial analysis, or other similar experience for a technology company. 2+ year minimum of experience in system maintenance, system customization, process documentation, and/or other similar experience. Hardware and software pricing experience preferred. Familiarity with cloud-based or utility-based pricing a plus. Must be very skilled with spreadsheets (Excel). Familiarity with Microsoft Access and other database tools a plus. Experience with Oracle ERP and SFDC CPQ systems a plus. Key Traits Job Description Highly analytical and detail-oriented, with superior problem-solving skills and a strong customer service orientation. Job Description The Senior QA Engineer will be part of this exciting development and will be working with a strong technical team that has experience delivering the solutions to large carriers. Participate in building a High end firewall platform for data centers/Carriers that provides high throughput packet processing to the service provider using latest networking technologies. Job Description Job Description Fortinet is looking for a Product Manager to join the R&D team to help drive initiatives for application deliver controller solutions. Job Description The Product Security Incident Response Team is looking for a Product Security Specialist, to handle Product Security related incidents, and to perform vulnerability research on Fortinet products. Find and report unknown vulnerabilities in Fortinet products via black box analysis, fuzzing, and source code auditing. Experience in pentesting methodologies and/or fuzzing tools a plus. Education BS in Computer Science or equivalent. Job Description Fortinet is growing and we are looking to hire Professional Services Engineers to join our team. The dedicated Professional Services consultant is assigned to the end user for the duration of this agreement. He/she will work with the end user to define the specific daily activities. Job Responsibilities The Professional Services Consultant daily activities include but are not limited to: Assisting client staff with day to day Fortinet products operation/ support Development of methods of procedure (MOPs) for migrations, upgrades and updates Development of test plans and test new features and/or releases Verifying configurations and implementing best practices Performing interoperability evaluation of devices that interact with Fortinet products Training and knowledge transfer to client staff Develop and maintain core competency on Fortinet’s product line and technologies Resolves and/or escalates issues in a timely fashion Requirements 7+ Years experience in LAN/WAN /Internet consulting, support and/or administration 5+ Years experience with Network Security Products 2+ Years experience with Fortinet products Experience working as a Professional Services Consultant/ Engineer a plus Solid understanding of security and networking principals and technologies such as: Network Security Infrastructure – Switching, Routing, Load Balancing, WiFi Security systems – Firewall, IPS, VPN, Antivirus, AntiSpam, Web Filtering, Application Control Excellent troubleshooting skills Outstanding oral communication and presentation skills Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities React to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently Flexible during times of change Ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources, including upper management, clients, and other departments Ability to bring project to successful completion through political sensitivity Strong commitment and self-driven individual Able to travel as needed Education Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related work related experience #GD

Job Description Position Overview Job Duties Creates and executes project work plans and revises as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements. Develops statements of work, WBS, and overall project schedule. Identifies resources needed and assigns individual responsibilities, by managing and monitoring team’s availability. Manages day-to-day operational aspects of projects, including scope, schedule, budget and quality Effectively applies Fortinet’s methodology and enforces project standards. Minimizes Fortinet’s exposure and risk on projects. Ensures project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately from beginning to end. Works closely with all customer-facing Fortinet functions, including sales, operations, order management, support and others to coordinate activities. Determines appropriate revenue recognition, ensures timely and accurate invoicing, and monitors receivables for project. Accurately forecasts revenue, profitability, margins, bill rates and utilization Assures project legal documents are completed and signed Facilitates PS, Presales & SE team and client meetings effectively. Effectively communicates relevant project information to executive management. Resolves and/or escalates issues in a timely fashion. Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully Highlight areas of improvement and recommend changes in methods, processes and tools. Monitor and manage operational and customer satisfaction metrics to meet organizational goals. Handle project escalations and follow up on customer satisfaction surveys. Build and maintain strong relationships with the sales teams. Recruit, hire and retain engineers for professional services, so the implementation processes can continue. Maintain a great working atmosphere that allows personal and professional development to each one of the team members. Define, document, enforce and enhance processes that speed up time for PS engagement request from Pre-sales team. Collaboratively work with peers within region, in order to work on initiatives which can help to give better service to our customers, partners and the security community in general. Manage relationships with customers, partners and corporate organizations to enhance technical support processes and drive PS projects’ satisfaction. Establish, document and enforce processes that allow higher efficiency and productivity. Align strategies to proactively avoid potential issues in any of the pre-sales processes established. Constant follow up to processes making sure they are maintained properly. Job Experience / Abilities Required Outstanding oral communication and presentation skills Strong familiarity with project management software, such as Microsoft Project. Experience as a Program Manager is a plus. Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities React to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently Flexible during times of change Excellent conflict resolution skills Ability to think creatively to develop new solutions to problems. Ability to create a vision, establish a plan, and ensure plan execution through success. Ability to coach others. Experience in a Professional Services role in a networking/security company or equivalent education. Demonstrated leadership skills. Full knowledge of all relevant business policies and practices. Strong ability to energize and lead others. Previous experience leading teams is a must. Multilingual skills are a plus: oral and/or written, Spanish and/or Portuguese. Good technical knowledge on computer networks and Internet security. Excellent organizational skills. Adaptable and flexible, operating in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Ability to work and take quick decisions under pressure. Willing to travel around 20% of the time. Job Summary Job Description As a Project Manager within Fortinet’s organization, you will be responsible for support of engineering development projects. You will serve as a liaison between software and hardware engineering, working with various cross-functional teams, e.g. engineering, operation, marketing, finance, and vendors to recognize, assess, and communicate issues and risks that impact schedule and budget. You will also be responsible for managing budgets, assets, and vendors. We are a group of self-starters, capable of providing on-site leadership within an eye for detail and quality. Responsibilities End-to-end ownership of Fortinet’s system platforms: from product concept to launch. Partner closely with Engineering, Operation, Marketing, Finance and other teams across Fortinet to understand their vision, objectives and opportunities for strategic alignment. Work with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize project tasks and risks. Manage ODM/CM partners and component vendors to ensure product design quality and delivery schedule. Help manage team's R&D assets (equipment) and purchasing plan. Oversee documentation effort with technical writers to ensure all necessary documentation for how to, support and troubleshooting tools are created & maintained. Minimum Qualifications Key Qualifications BS/MS degree – Engineering, MBA preferred. 5+ years of professional work experience in Project Management, Operations, Finance, Accounting, Management Consulting, or other high-performance organization. Demonstrated success in managing multiple activities/projects, priorities, and people in a fast-paced, high-growth, results-driven environment Excellent communication, interpersonal, analytical/problem-solving skills, and the ability to work with cross-functional teams. Understands and can manage Engineering development cycles; remains flexible and calm in the face of ambiguity Detailed knowledge and understanding of product development processes Experience with hardware development life cycles and ODM/CM working models. Team-first outlook, with the ability to build great working relationships with peers across functions. Strong technical, analytical and cross-functional collaboration skills. Job Description Department Overview: Reporting to a Sr. Manager, we are looking for someone who has an interest in HW QC and Test, but a passion for getting things done. Work with a team of 10+ Engineers, you will be validating the HW platforms for the current and next generation products. This is a great opportunity to immerse yourself in all phases of HW development cycle to reach new product launches and features development for our products. Responsibilities While this is an individual contributor role, you’ll be involved in many aspects– helping evolve our existing architecture, working with teams to improve product quality, operations, and implementing new features and functionalities. This position offers a large scope of experience and direct involvement with complex and innovative technology. In addition, you will be working alongside a close-knit team of experienced software, hardware and ASIC developers. HW Test Engineer for networking products Work with cross functional teams and external teams (ODM/JDM/CM) to drive resolution Participate in design reviews Support the development of validation Hardware/Software and debug of test failures Design development HW test cases, create HW test plans, implement, automate and execute test cases Support the development team to perform debugging of failed development and production products Prepare reports, documents/statistics to support test results Work with the development team to identify root cause and implement corrective actions Contribute in improving the yield during the development phase and production Work with the development team to contribute in suppliers’ component FA process Support the development team to evaluate and qualify components Participate in system and chip bring up tasks when necessary Participate in the Quality Report Generation Team player Efficient self-starter Good verbal & written communication skills Multi-tasking & problem solving skills Experience: You are experienced, but you also like to learn new things. And you want to work with smart people and have fun building great HW Platforms. Must be proficient using PC/PC-Hardware and Software/Communication Ports/Communication Software. (i.e., HyperTerminal, Com ports, etc). Knowledge and experience of programming language: Python, Xml, Perl, VBS, C, Perl, JavaScript (a plus). 2 years+ work experiences in a Network Design and/or testing/troubleshooting experiences in Manufacturing environment. Knowledge of general QA procedures and methodologies Must be a team player, willing to learn and solving problems. Educational Requirements Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related fields Newly graduates are welcomed to apply, Training will provide for the qualified candidate. Warehouse working environment. Can lift 40 lbs. About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Job Description The successful candidate will be working within the Quality Management team and focus on product quality data collecting, analyzing and monitoring in each stage of product lifecycle to support quality management team addressing quality issues and improving product quality from NPI to after sale. Proven capability and skill sets on working with design teams to address and resolve product quality issues, the candidate also needs to have proven track records on product quality control, engineering process improvement and quality statistic data analysis. The position is based in Sunnyvale, CA, USA Job Responsibilities Work with HW PM and R&D teams to track and monitor the quality status of NPI models in each development phase to ensure LPA quality requirements meet. Collect and maintain product quality data (HW & SW) in each product stage such as NPI, PQC, IQC, RMA etc. for key product lines and identify major product failure modes through quality data statistical analysis. Identify quality issues, conduct root cause analysis, define feasible and meaningful goals, and drive quality initiatives and corrective actions for results. Work closely with HW/SW design teams to address quality issues of key product lines identified in NPI phase, mass production phase and after sale. Track and maintain product quality related RCA, CAR/PAR tickets; build and maintain a valuable lessons learnt quality database and provide valuable quality feedback and suggestions to design teams through quality case study and failure analysis. Play a key role to leverage internal resources to support Technical Support teams to address customer escalated product quality issues. Perform data mining and follow up with both in-house design team and off-shore OEM partner/supplier to support root cause analysis in situations where quality data are not readily available. Support functional teams’ business needs to create processes as part of QMS per team’s requests. Proactively initiate and execute new ideas to improve products and processes quality. Perform internal audit as necessary, and involve and support annual ISO external audit. Job Skills Required 10+ years of professional experience in IT or related industry, including 3+ years project management experience with continuous process and quality improvement focus. Solid background in hardware and software engineering practice in the meantime grasps a good understanding of hardware design and manufacturing process. Solid knowledge of networking, routing, switching, firewalls, routers, etc. Previous hands on experience in identifying product failure modes and conducting root cause analysis is required. Previous experience of using scripting tools (e.g. pl, Python, etc.) for product quality data analysis is a plus. Previous experience of participating in ISO audit is a plus. A professional attitude and fastidious attention to details. Self-motivated, multi-tasking, ability to work alone, or in a team and under pressure. Excellent verbal and written communications and people skills. Educational Requirements Bachelor or Master degree in Comp. Science, Engineering or other relevant technical field, or equivalent combination of work experience and education #GD

Job Description Regional Account Manager The Regional Account Manager (RAM) is an exciting new role within the Fortinet sales organization that is focused on an important subset of the mid-market segment. The RAM is a field sales position responsible for a specific set of mid-market accounts while also having shared responsibility for all mid-market business within their territory. The ideal candidate will have previous field sales experience in the B2B technology space. The RAM will create and execute an account plan from prospecting to building and maintaining a constant revenue pipeline. Fortinet will provide initial onboarding education to begin your career. Once completed, you will be assigned an individual territory and quota and given ongoing enablement and coaching to achieve the highest levels of success. Success in the RAM role provides many options in the overall career path at Fortinet. Responsibilities Meet or exceed all assigned quotas and targets while forecasting weekly, monthly and quarterly revenues for the assigned account set and overall territory Meet or exceed the required number of face-to-face meetings each month with customers and partners in territory to identify new opportunities and grow existing opportunities. Full participation in all team activities for enablement, forecasting, partner updates, partner sales efforts and recognition. Create and track sales opportunities (leads, renewals, deal registrations and quotes in Salesforce.com) Address any customer satisfaction issues and/or requests in a timely manner Drive sales cycles to close while establishing relationships and credibility, and provide necessary presales support for prospects & customers. Work closely with your local Channel Account Manager (CAM) and our reseller partner network to drive deals, increase revenue, and enable channel partners’ success in the mid-market segment. Follow up on inbound, web and corporate event leads Accept inbound and perform outbound prospecting activities to identify new sales opportunities. Meet and exceed the sales activity metrics designed to make you productive and successful. Lead customer presentation and demos via online tools (GO TO MEETING) Perform ongoing analysis and report on opportunities that are supported Act as a liaison between partner, customers, and appropriate Fortinet team members Perform other duties and projects, as assigned to support the growth or our business Execute the role with the utmost professionalism and in a way that aligns to Fortinet’s core values Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree Coachable and flexible 3-5 years of field sales experience in the B2B technology space Working knowledge of the businesses and partners in the local territory Ability to run productive customer-facing and partner-facing meetings while providing timely and relevant written follow up A proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales quotas and targets Understanding of the sales cycle in conjunction with business processes internally and externally Ability to manage and drive sales cycles from start to finish, which includes experience with managing and forecasting individual quota Self-driven and able to manage a diverse, high volume workload Ability to quickly build productive relationships in a fast-paced, high-performance environment Be computer savvy Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills Well organized with effective time and activity management skills Ability to apply entrepreneurial strengths in a driven, forward-thinking manner Ability to close business while achieving a high level of customer and partner satisfaction Execute the role with the utmost professionalism and in a way that aligns to Fortinet’s core values Preferred Qualifications Public/private cloud experience is a plus Experience with multi-tier distribution a plus. Experience in networking, security and/or public/private cloud a plus About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Job Description Fortinet is seeking a SOAR’ing Account Manager to uncover, manage, and drive regional sales engagements in collaboration with Fortinet Field Sales and Channel Partner teams. Job Description Position: Regional Sales Manager – SMB Segment Objective In this new role, you will lead and manage a team of field-based sales representatives in the fastest growing segment within Fortinet – Small & Medium Business (SMB). As the SMB Segment at Fortinet expands, we are looking for a strong leader to help craft the sales execution strategy, assist with the recruitment & hiring of SMB field sales reps, and ensure that your sales team effectively spreads the Fortinet value proposition across all SMB accounts in your territory, resulting in consistent over-attainment against all sales targets for all sales reps on your team. Responsibilities Lead, manage and motivate a team of Regional Account Managers (RAM) focused on SMB accounts Ensure that every RAM on your team meets or exceeds their sales targets every quarter Assist in the recruitment, hiring and onboarding of Regional Account Managers (RAM) Develop plans at a rep level to achieve goals and exceed quota responsibility. These plans include new customer acquisition, customer growth, channel engagement, alignment with SMB Inside Territory Account Managers (ITAM), sales rep enablement and sales rep career path. Ensure alignment with the Inside Territory Account Managers and sales leaders in the Plano, TX call center that align with your territory Serve as an escalation point of contact in the event of customer satisfaction issues Help upper management establish quota for your sales reps and for your territory more broadly Ensure all sales plays and other marketing programs are successfully implemented by your sales reps Develop relationships with key decision makers, influencers and partners for the most strategic accounts and sales opportunities in your territory Run productive weekly 1x1 management and coaching sessions with each sales rep on your team. Ensure that Fortinet’s technical engineering overlay sales team is properly leveraged by your sales reps Accurate weekly forecasting to upper management for all sales results and new sales opportunities Significant travel (ie, up to 70%) within assigned territory is required Be a role model of professionalism and Fortinet’s core values Required Skills 5+ years technology sales experience Previous leadership and/or mentoring experience and accomplishments Experience in the network security industry A proven track record of significant over-quota achievement and demonstrated career stability Experience in selling collaboratively with channel partners (VAR, SI, MSSP, etc) Strong presentation skills to executive level & individual contributors Excellent written and verbal communication skills Be computer savvy Experience in sales quota assignment, pipeline management and forecasting Flexible and execution-minded professional Strong business acumen and positive leadership abilities with proven results in mentoring, motivating and developing teams Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent, MBA preferred.

Job Description We are looking for a Regional Systems Engineer to work closely with a sales representative in a defined territory. The Regional Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales organization in all technical matters regarding pre-sales, sales calls, and post-sales. Responsibilities Pre-sales - assist in qualifying sales leads from a technical standpoint. Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer/ educate the customer on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Conversant with networking applications and solutions. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Provide assistance to identified customers with post-sales training. Required Skills 5 – 8 years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer 5 - 7 years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration 5 - 7 years of experience with Wireless technologies, deploying, supporting and doing site surveys. Strong understanding of Wireless Authentication technologies Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Fluent in English Education Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. Graduate degree preferred. Certifications: CCIE, CISSP About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Job Description Retail Sales Director – West US Job Description Fortinet offers retailers a broad set of network and security technologies that are seamlessly integrated and automated with the Fortinet Security Fabric. For retailers seeking to address a number of use cases—ranging from offering an Omni-channel approach to improving the efficiency of business operations to enhancing guest experience, Fortinet solutions can solve many of their network infrastructure and security requirements. As a key member of Fortinet’s Retail Team, you will create, manage and drive revenue generating activities with field sales, channel sales and our partners using Fortinet’s Retail go-to-market strategy. Responsibilities Sales – Assist the team as an overlay specialist resource across Retail opportunities in our Commercial and Enterprise territories to achieve quarterly sales goals Translate – Build the bridge between business needs and technology requirements Advise – Act as trusted advisor for C Level, Director and VP executives for the Apparel, Grocery, Convenience Store, Restaurant, Pharmacy, Gas Stations, Hotels, Department Store, Home Improvement, Automotive and Furniture Store sub-verticals Discover – Penetrate new whitespace accounts and find opportunities to upsell and cross-sell Fortinet solutions into existing customers Present – Speak at different industry events, customer locations and or partner sites Required Skills Experience selling into Retail’s distributed remote site environment Proven ability to sell multi-product solutions A proven track record of quota achievement and demonstrated career stability Excellent presentation skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Competitive, self-motivated and independent thinker that can help move deals forward 10+ years of experience in outside selling 10+ years of experience selling security, network and or telecom solutions Ability to travel 40 - 50% Education Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

Job Description Revenue Analyst Overview We’re looking for a detail-oriented Revenue Analyst to work cross-functionally within Fortinet in driving revenue recognition controls and processes as the Company scales to $4 billion and strives to be the top security company globally. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who would like to play a key role in Finance/Revenue, to develop his/her career progressively and comprehensively at a fast growing company in the field of network security. This role will report to the Revenue Manager. Responsibilities Assist with the monthly/quarterly/yearly close process, SOX and audit compliance, including preparation of journal entries, account reconciliations, and various financial analyses Perform revenue analytics and prepare month-end and quarter-end presentations for management Assist in, track and coordinate quarterly confirmations Participate in sample validation testing of transactions Contribute to audit preparation by providing requested documentation and analysis Stay current on evolving Accounting Standards pronouncements and updates under prevailing regulatory bodies (FASB, SEC) and incorporating into current Company policy as necessary. Perform other duties and projects as assigned Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, CPA a plus Extensive knowledge of US GAAP revenue recognition principles and ability to apply (specifically ASC 606) SOX internal controls experience Self-starter and with a proactive approach to problem solving, high degree of attention to detail and has the drive to follow through on commitments Ability to manage multiple competing projects in a time sensitive manner Minimum of 3 years public accounting or corporate accounting related experience, preferably in the technology industry Excellent Microsoft Office skills, specifically Excel and Powerpoint Experience with RevPro, Oracle, Salesforce, Tableau a plus Strong communication skills (verbal and written) within a fast-paced environment Eagerness to learn and adapt as part of an evolving team
