S. Degree in Accounting or Finance Experience with Oracle, RevPro, Salesforce.com and Tableau, desirable Detailed knowledge of ASC 606 and related revenue pronouncements CPA or equivalent accounting certification strongly preferred 5-10+ years of revenue accounting and related experience, preferably in the technology industry Must have excellent analytical, problem-solving and collaborative skills Curious and a quick learner who loves a fast-paced environment High degree of attention to detail Creative mind set to solve big-picture problems while remaining detail-oriented to solve the smaller ones Desired Knowledge/Skills Ability to work independently to accomplish tasks with minimal supervision Ability to juggle multiple tasks, establish appropriate priorities and meet deadlines "Self-starter" with outstanding analytical, communication, and technical skills and a can-do attitude. Strong understanding of larger-company finance and accounting practices Excellent quantitative and analytical skills Confidence, good judgment, energy and personality to work in a dynamic, multi-business unit environment across all levels of management and across business units, functions and geographies

Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Fortinet has over 10,000+ employees globally and we are continuing to grow. Fortinet ranks #1 in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet. We sell our solutions through a network of distributors and resellers and serve all industries and customer segments. About The Job As a Sales Operations and Compensation Analyst you will be working in a global role supporting the Fortinet Sales team. Your role includes assisting with the month-end close process, by managing commission crediting data and ensuring accuracy of the sales crediting data. Your goal will be to not only address crediting needs by Sales but also collaborate with our Commission and IT team to continuously update and improve our crediting process. Responsibilities Work in the Compensation team supporting field management and resolving crediting queries and disputes. Maintain and manage participant information including crediting and commission validation. Coordinate with the Commission team to support the month-end and quarter-end close process. Support Sales teams in identifying opportunities to drive efficiency and best practice. Help drive webinars to promote adoption of the multiple Sales tools: Tableau, OA and Salesforce. Answer questions from OA users about functionality. Address Tableau dashboard crediting inquiries. Use SQL to answer Sales crediting questions. Analyze and report key performance indicators related to: Oracle billing remaps Required Skills 3-5 years of relevant Finance, or Sales Compensation/Operations experience, preferably in the technology industry. Advanced MS Excel skills, knowledge of Tableau, SFDC and SQL. Proficient in manipulating systems tools, manual calculations and modeling, with large data sets. Demonstrated ability to have completed multiple, moderately complex projects with coordinated efforts of several peer groups. Strong oral and written communication skills. This individual must work effectively with Staff to Vice President level employees within the organization. Ability to work collaboratively and act in a lead role as a subject matter expert, within a team environment to meet aggressive goals, deadlines, and pre-defined measurement criteria. High attention to detail while maintaining and managing confidential compensation data. Creative approach to problem solving.

Job Description SAP Security Sales Engineer, GSI Objective Fortinet is seeking an SAP security engineer supporting Global Systems Integrators (GSIs) business development. jobTitle: Senior Counsel, Legal and Compliance, Americas
jobDescription: Job Description Fortinet, the leading Silicon Valley security innovator, is recruiting a Senior Counsel, Legal and Compliance, Americas, t o join our Legal team in our Sunnyvale headquarters. This opportunity will report to the Vice President, Legal and Compliance, Americas. Fortinet is well positioned in the dynamic information technology security market, securing enterprises around the world, and is poised to be the leading security company worldwide with more than $4 billion in annual global revenue and over 10,000 employees worldwide. We are a truly international and financially stable company, run by brilliant and entrepreneurial founders, determined to maintain our entrepreneurial and fast-paced roots, while scaling as appropriate (and this position is a clear reflection of our growth!). This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who has strong business judgment, good initiative, has good common business sense, is self-motivated, a quick learner, and is a legal “utility player” who has the desire to manage numerous new issues that arise in a fast paced and dynamic environment. The right candidate should have strong legal and business acumen, strong commercial negotiating skills, as well as the capability of managing a wide range of legal business matters. As a Senior Legal Counsel, you will responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and negotiating sales agreements with Fortinet’s largest commercial customers in the Americas. You will work with Fortinet’s sales teams and executives to negotiate sales agreements for products, services, and software. Candidates who are confident they have the following attributes should apply: A positive, can-do attitude. A person who appreciates a successful tech company in the exciting, dynamic and growing security industry. Someone with the initiative, iron gut, business judgement and intelligence to drive and create business and add value in a fast-paced, high-pressure and ever-changing environment. Versatility, a quick learner and the ability to effectively drive forward and execute positive results on different types of legal matters. Job Duties Assist in the development and negotiation strategy, providing input and guidance on the commercial and legal elements of transactions. Interact effectively with senior management and have a successful track record as both a legal advisor and business leader. Collaborate with, and advise cross-functionally stakeholders, including service, sales, operations , marketing, product and engineering, and finance, to ensure that agreements adequately protect Fortinet’s interests. Review and provide input on terms and conditions contained in RFP’s and sales proposals. Lead negotiations for the sale of hardware products, services, and software. Assist Fortinet’s VP of Legal and Compliance, Americas with reviewing, structuring, drafting and negotiating vendor, procurement, and marketing agreements, contract manufacturing, OEM and ODM agreements, real estate purchase and lease agreements, alliance agreements, sales agreements, assisting with RFPs, providing Certifications, reviewing NDAs and other legal related activities. Assist the Legal team with other matters, such as perhaps litigation matters and disputes, on an as-needed basis. Assist Fortinet’s VP, General Counsel with Corporate Development, M&A activities and Strategic Alliances as needed. Own reviewing, structuring, drafting and negotiating complex enterprise sales agreements, marketing and vendor agreements, reviewing and providing sales certifications, reviewing NDAs and other legal related activities in the United States and other geographic areas as needed. Own compliance initiatives and controls for the United States, including compliance training and controls and other matters. Own the cross-functional approval process for complex sales agreements. Manage outside counsel and assist with subsidiary management, and other issues as needed. Substantial time at Fortinet’s Sunnyvale headquarters, Covid permitting, and periodic travel may be required Job Experience Experienced attorney with 5+ years of relevant sales negotiation and transactional legal experience required in the U.S. and transactional experience related to Canada and/or Latin America a plus. The ideal candidate has in-house experience with knowledge of the technology/computer industry, preferably cybersecurity. Educational Requirement J.D. from a top law school, with demonstrated success based on GPA and other accomplishments; California bar admission required. Technical degree a plus. Job Description We are looking for a Senior Incident Response Consultant to work in a dynamic and exciting new position reporting to the FortiGuard Incident Response Global Operations Manager. The analyst will work directly with members of a world class incident response and forensics team. Our team is comprised of individuals with strong knowledge in malware hunting and analysis, reverse engineering, multiple scripting languages, forensics and threat actors TTPs. In this very hands-on customer facing role the consultant’s main objective is to work with the incident response lead during engagements and train/mentor other security consultants. Leveraging your in-depth understanding of the threat actors’ tactics, techniques, procedures and tools as well as our flagship FortiEDR tooling you will need to quickly glean situational awareness to provide guidance to the team members as well as to the client. In addition, from time to time the candidate will help to create threat research work products such as blogs and presentations. To be successful in this role the candidate must be possess strong consulting skills, deep technical skills and able to work under tight timelines. Responsibilities Assist the IR Lead during engagements and mentoring/training junior analysis Continue to focus on process improvement for the customer facing incident response services Conduct host-based analysis and forensic functions on Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X systems Conduct network forensics and log analysis during IR engagements Review firewall, web, database, and other log sources to identify evidence and artifacts of malicious and compromised activity Leverage our FortiEDR Platform to conduct investigations to rapidly detect and analyze security threats Perform memory forensics and file analysis as needed Monitor underground forums, our FortiGuard Threat Labs, along with other open-source intelligence outlets to maintain proficiency in latest actor tactics and techniques Preform basic reverse engineering of threat actor’s malicious tools Develop complete and informative reports and presentations for both executive and technical audience Availability during nights/weekends as needed for IR engagements Required Skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills a must Experience interfacing with customers Experience with of at least one scripting language: Shell, Ruby, Perl, Python, etc Ability to data mine using YARA, RegEx or other techniques to identify new threats Experienced with EnCase, FTK, X-Ways, SIFT, Splunk, Redline, Volatility, WireShark, TCPDump, and open source forensic tools a plus Experience with malware analysis tools such as IDA Pro, OllyDbg, Immunity Debugger Hands-on experience dealing with APT campaigns, attack Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTPs), memory injection techniques, static and dynamic malware analysis and malware persistence mechanism Strong knowledge of operating system internals and endpoint security experience. Able to communicate with both technical and executive personnel Static and dynamic malware and log analysis Analysis of Linux and MAC binary files and the understanding of MAC internals is a plus but not required . Job Description We are looking for an Information Security Engineer experienced in Cloud/SOAR development to work in a dynamic and exciting new position reporting to the Security Operation Center Manager of our FortiGuard Responder MDR Services. Our team is comprised of individuals with strong knowledge in malware hunting and analysis, reverse engineering, multiple scripting languages, forensics, and threat actors TTPs. In this very dynamic role the engineer’s main objective is to build exciting new solutions to routine manual processes across a variety of tools and disciplines, leading the evaluation, integration and testing of new Cyber tools and technologies. You should see different technologies as a means to an end and be well practiced at hunting for a solution through unfamiliar territory. To be successful in this role the candidate must possess strong cross-platform development skills and be able to work under tight timelines. Responsibilities Work closely with a small team to build and maintain a public-facing GDPR-compliant cloud platform leveraging FortiSOAR and AWS Work closely with the Security Operations Center (SOC), Incident Response, and Threat Hunting teams to improve existing automation and deliver resilient security solutions Assess, design, and improve SOC processes and workflows with a focus on integrating automation through Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) tools and technologies Integrate new logging sources and build playbooks to properly triage and respond to security incidents while reducing the time needed to analyze each event Develop custom scripts to automate current detection and response workflows. Job Description Fortinet is looking for a Senior Software Development QA Engineer to assist FortiCNP. FortiCNP is a cloud-native protection platform natively integrated with Cloud Service Providers’ (CSP) security services and Fortinet’s Security Fabric to deliver a comprehensive, full-stack cloud security solution for securing cloud workloads. FortiCNP’s patented Risk Resource Insights (RRI)TM technology simplifies security by contextualizing security findings and prioritizing the most critical resources with actionable insights to help security teams effectively manage cloud risk. Responsibilities Research, analyze, design and review system specifications of customer centric cloud security products. Work within hybrid software development and test team to design new cloud security features and conduct release testing. Design user stories and test cases based on feature requirements and user cases. Execute test cases manually and automatically. Analyze test results and report issues to development team. Maintain and develop auto test codes to validate all aspect of products based on variety of test cases. Assist customer issues diagnosis and duplicate customer using scenarios. Provide tier-2 supports for the team’s products. Provide end-to-end quality assurance solutions for cloud security products to the development, marketing, sales team and etc. Bring cutting edge cloud security products into the competitive market. Requirements Strong knowledge in Docker containers, system virtualization and cloud computing; Strong knowledge in DevOps, CI/CD, and IT Infrastructure. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Excellent customer perspective understanding of product architecture and functionalities; Excellent understanding of various aspects to the software quality assurance discipline such as testing methodologies(black box, white box),types of test (Non-functional, Regression, user Acceptance) and other test topics(Scope); Analytical mind, problem solving attitude and strong organizational skills; Familiar with TCP/IP, switching, routing and firewall knowledge. Familiar with at least one computer language(preferably Java ,Python) and automation test frameworks, such as Cucumber and WebDriver/Selenium based UI automation; Familiar with database knowledge and SQL; Exceptional attentions to details, and a real knack for finding bugs and breaking software; Minimum of 2 years of software testing or development experience; Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Electrical Engineering or equivalent Additional Qualifications Familiar with AWS/Azure/Google Cloud is a plus; Familiar with WAN/LAN technology is a plus. Job Description We are looking for a highly motivated, organized, and detail-oriented senior Software Development Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be validating ASIC (Applied Specific Integrated Circuit) drivers and software for our current and next generation products. In addition, you will use your knowledge of networking, operating systems, and automation to analyze and replicate issues reported internally and by our customers, isolate root causes, and verify bug fixes. You will be working alongside a closely-knit team of experienced software, hardware, and ASIC engineers. Job Responsibilities Design, develop, and execute scripts, test plans and functional, regression and performance test cases, based on feature/hardware specifications. Identify and document software defects found during verification. Replicate and drive customer issues to resolutions. Work closely with software/hardware developers, other QA teams, and support/field teams to ensure defects are correctly identified, reproduced, and fixed. Contribute to the development, deployment, and operation of automated test cases and/or automation tools. Basic Qualifications Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field. Solid understanding of TCP/IP, routing, switching and firewalls. Strong Linux command line skills, and the ability to use Linux effectively to create test environments and troubleshoot issues. Demonstrated experience with Ruby. Strong programming skills and knowledge of software development fundamentals. Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot software and networks logically and analytically. Fundamental knowledge of Linux operating systems internals, kernel, and drivers. At least 2 years of experience troubleshooting and replicating complex network issues. In-depth knowledge of 5 or more of the following: network packet analyzers (e.g., Wireshark), IPsec, IPv6 (IP version 6) , TLS, benchmark testing, multicast, VXLAN, QoS (Quality of Service) , building tools to generate traffic. Understanding of quality assurance and test methodologies. Demonstrated ability to produce clear problem statements and test reports. Strong communications skills, and ability to work in a collaborative cross-functional environment. Ability to work on assigned tasks under tight time constraints, complete tasks with minimal supervision, and research new topics. Preferred Qualifications Extensive experience replicating network issues reported by a wide range of customers. Experience building test automation frameworks. Experience in using Spirent or Keysight (Ixia, Breaking Point) traffic generator is a plus. Job Description Position: Regional Field Sales Manager – SMB Segment Objective In this role, you will lead and manage a team of field-based sales reps in the fastest growing segment within Fortinet – Small & Medium Business (SMB).As the SMB Segment at Fortinet expands, we are looking for a strong leader to help further develop the sales execution strategy, assist with the recruitment & hiring of SMB field sales reps, and ensure that your sales team effectively spreads the Fortinet value proposition across all SMB accounts in your territory, resulting in consistent over-attainment against all sales targets for all sales reps on your team. Responsibilities Lead, manage and motivate a team of field-based Regional Account Managers (RAM) focused on SMB accounts Ensure that every RAM on your team meets or exceeds their sales targets every quarter Assist in the recruitment, hiring and onboarding of Regional Account Managers (RAM) Develop plans at a rep level to achieve goals and exceed quota responsibility.These plans include new customer acquisition, customer growth, channel engagement, sales rep enablement and sales rep career path. Job Description We are looking for a highly motivated, organized, and detail-oriented intermediate Software Development Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be validating ASIC (Applied Specific Integrated Circuit) drivers and software for our current and next generation products. In addition, you will use your knowledge of networking, operating systems, and automation to analyze and replicate issues reported internally and by our customers, isolate root causes, and verify bug fixes. You will be working alongside a closely-knit team of experienced software, hardware, and ASIC engineers. Job Responsibilities Design, develop, and execute scripts, test plans and functional, regression and performance test cases, based on feature/hardware specifications. Identify and document software defects found during verification. Replicate and drive customer issues to resolutions. Work closely with software/hardware developers, other QA teams, and support/field teams to ensure defects are correctly identified , reproduced, and fixed. Contribute to the development, deployment, and operation of automated test cases and/or automation tools. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field. Solid understanding of TCP/IP, routing, switching and firewalls. At least 1 year of experience troubleshooting and replicating complex network issues. Strong Linux command line skills, and the ability to use Linux effectively to create test environments and troubleshoot issues. In-depth knowledge of 3 or more of the following: network packet analyzers (e.g., Wireshark), IPsec, IPv6 (IP version 6) , TLS, benchmark testing, multicast, VXLAN, QoS (Quality of Service) (Quality of Service) , building tools to generate traffic. Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot software and networks logically and analytically . Demonstrated experience with Python or Ruby. Understanding of quality assurance and test methodologies. Demonstrated ability to produce clear problem statements and test reports. Strong communications skills, and ability to work in a collaborative cross-functional environment. Ability to work on assigned tasks under tight time constraints, complete tasks with minimal supervision, and research new topics. Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field. Strong programming skills and knowledge of software development fundamentals. Extensive experience replicating network issues reported by a wide range of customers. Knowledge of operating systems (preferably Linux) internals, kernel, and drivers. Successful candidates will possess a mix of technical aptitude, professionalism, and social skills to engage with and gain respect from the analyst community, C-level executives, sales, technical, and finance executives. Description Fortinet is seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Analyst Relations (AR) manager to join its existing AR team. The AR manager will create and drive analyst relations programs in select technology areas to effectively communicate key differentiators for Fortinet’s solutions, and work closely with key industry analysts as strategic partners. The senior manager will champion positive relationships with leading industry analysts to influence them to shortlist Fortinet on client inquiry calls and drive Fortinet’s position in key industry analyst reports. This is a highly visible role and will focus on Fortinet’s vision, strategy, product differentiation and business results, so analysts can represent Fortinet accurately and as favorably as possible. The senior manager will lead the planning and execution of analyst inquiry and briefings, as well as responses to key industry analyst reports including Gartner Magic Quadrants, IDC MarketScapes and Forrester Waves. The Senior Manager will report to Fortinet’s Senior Director Analyst Relations. Candidates for this role must be comfortable with balancing strategic thinking with tactical, detailed execution while working independently, and adjusting to sudden and frequent change. Fortinet is based in Sunnyvale, CA. The Senior AR Manager position reports into our Corporate Team, which is open to remote work scenarios. The position will require periodic travel. Primary Responsibilities Develop and foster strong relationships with key industry analysts Partner with Product Marketing and Management to develop, execute, and project manage analyst relations programs for select solution areas Build Fortinet’s presence and drive awareness amongst industry analysts of Fortinet’s solutions, vision, and strategy to significantly expand analyst understanding of Fortinet’s portfolio breadth and depth, as well as the company’s unique industry differentiation Deliver on-going AR program activities such as analyst briefings, analyst inquiries, reporting and other core program tactics Schedule and prepare Fortinet spokespeople for analyst inquiry and briefings Plan and lead effective strategy sessions (e.g., SAS days) with select analysts Proactively and simultaneously manage multiple vendor ratings in key reports such as Gartner Magic Quadrants, IDC MarketScapes, and Forrester Waves Prioritize and manage incoming requests for information, research review, and customer references Produce and/or edit AR content including presentations, research notes, and other related materials Execute AR reporting and measurement programs. Track and report analyst interactions, coverage, and progress Requirements 5+ years of corporate or agency high-tech analyst relations experience, including experience in the security or networking sectors Successful track record of developing and executing on an analyst relations strategy Exceptional interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to build confidence across multiple functions and levels of an organization Strong organizational and project management skills Strong attention to detail and an ability to handle numerous fast paced projects simultaneously Familiarity with the analyst relations database program (ARchitect) Preference for existing analyst relationships

Job Description Job Title: Senior Events Manager Job Description And Responsibilities We are looking for an experienced, professional, Senior Event Manager to support the strategy and execution of key partner and customer trade shows and events. This high-visibility role enables you to collaborate with all levels and groups across the organization, while also being hands-on in bringing every event, whether virtual, in-person or a combination of both, to life. What You'll Bring Ten (10) or more years’ experience in event and trade show management A keen eye for building events that engage, instruct and delight 1 – 2 years’ experience in virtual event management Deep understanding of, and experience building complex registration processes using event management platforms Proven expertise in leading complex, multi-audience events, often with several (virtual) locations over multiple days Ability to work collaboratively and act independently Strategic thinking and creative problem-solving and an ability to glean insights, develop a vision and bring it to life with actionable plans Creative strategies for generating actionable leads at key trade shows Comfortable attitude developing and managing timelines, budgets, briefs, project plans, etc. Understanding of the key drivers of successful event execution in digital, physical, and hybrid mediums including broadcast experience Ability to demonstrate how events align with and make an impact on Fortinet’s key business drivers Experience using the latest event technologies, including streaming platforms, registration and participant management platforms, agenda management tools, recording and editing tools, event promotion tools, project and resource management tools, and tools for live event engagement (polls, Q&As, etc.). Polished skills to work in a highly matrixed environment and influence outcomes at all levels of the organization Excellent written and oral communication skills Enthusiasm to thrive in an environment of rapid change, moving targets, limited resources, and cross-functional dependencies Fanatic excitement for all things events Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required Approximately 40% travel (post-pandemic) How You Will Succeed Drive innovative, data-driven event experiences in the new world (post-pandemic) of events (trade show, conferences and virtual) Design creative and inspired event experiences that impress and engage our audiences, including concept, vision, communication strategies that leads to registration, event tech, logistics, and budgeting Develop and foster stakeholder trust by initiating and nurturing strong cross-functional partnerships Deploy proven strategies for best-in-class event design, whether in-person, virtual or hybrid Deliver flawless implementation of event operations with teammates, partners, and stakeholders Direct resources to deliver against competing event schedules. Identify and problem solve resourcing risks. Develop and own relationships with internal stakeholders, agencies, and vendors to ensure best-in-class work is consistently delivered. Demonstrate measurable business impact based on the goals outlined for each experience. Decipher post-event analytics and data into recommendations for best practices. Stay ahead of the latest experiential innovations in the industry. This is an exciting opportunity for Senior Event Manager, with proven skills for keeping engagement levels high in a fast-paced environment, and driving results through collaboration, resourcefulness, and teamwork. A successful candidate will have comfort with ambiguity, strong conceptual thinking, interpersonal and organizational skills, excellent written communication skills, and a demonstrated work ethic. The role requires a strong ability to drive outcomes and to cultivate differences by welcoming diverse perspectives and solutions. This position will work on confidential and sensitive projects, requiring discretion and good judgment. What It Takes A strong people person who can inspire teams. Significant experience with event planning (minimum of 10 years), including trade shows, conferences, and online/virtual events. Works well with all levels, from wait staff to executives. Able to conceptualize the experience of an event and then bring it to life

Job Description Sr. FP&A Manager Location – HQ Sunnyvale, CA (hybrid) Job Description Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security features without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks #1 in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 400,000 customers trust Fortinet. About The Job We are looking to hire a top-tier finance leader for a Senior Finance Manager position, who will work as a key member in the FP&A team and provide finance partnership cross-functionally to formulate and achieve our strategic and financial goals. You will play a critical role in preparing proactive reporting and analysis of key performance measurement indicator and help build a strong FP&A organization that enables our continued hypergrowth. The ideal candidate will have a successfully track record of effective business partnership and outstanding financial reporting/modeling skills. Responsibilities Revenue Forecast Support Support business planning , analytics, and reporting, and drive monthly, quarterly and annual financial planning and forecasting cycles. Perform in-depth, comprehensive financial analysis, including extracting insights from data/ analyses, identifying drivers and implications, and translating findings into practical recommendations. Develop solid cadence in reporting insightful business metrics, for example, product mix and margin analysis. Build rigor round data hygiene, ensure integrity, accuracy and consistency in reporting and leverage the power of data to educate and engage business owners and finance peers. Partner with cross functional groups to drive enhancements and improve data infrastructure. Implement and drive efficient, effective and comprehensive process and procedures to allow faster and scalable planning and forecast cycle. Acquisition integration and finance support Help to build and train offshore finance support (India) standardizing and streamlining the standard reporting. Responsible for financial model development to support and enable business decisions. Lead strategy projects and ad hoc requests Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent practical experience; Advanced degree preferred 12+ years of relevant work experience in the fields of financial planning and analysis, corporate finance, or accounting Superior analytical and modeling capacities Outstanding software and system skills with extensive experience in Hyperion Cloud, Oracle Financial Applications and Tableau Must be detail oriented to ensure accuracy and quality of output Must be flexible in job assignments Preferred Qualifications Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities Ability to think strategically and operate effectively with the Management team and other business partners Self-motivated and comfortable managing shifting priorities, achieving effective results within tight deadlines, and working across diverse & fast-paced assignments Ability to provide driving metrics and reporting for enhanced business monitoring & growth visibility Analytical mindset who can also focus on the big picture Experience designing and scaling processes that support a fast growth business environment Strong communicator

Job Description Sr. Manager – New Media About Fortinet Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) makes possible a digital world that we can always trust through its mission to protect people, devices, and data everywhere. This is why the world’s largest enterprises, service providers, and government organizations choose Fortinet to securely accelerate their digital journey. The Fortinet Security Fabric platform delivers broad, integrated, and automated protections across the entire digital attack surface, securing critical devices, data, applications, and connections from the data center to the cloud to the home office. Ranking #1 in the most security appliances shipped worldwide, more than 615,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Learn more at https://www.fortinet.com , the Fortinet Blog , or FortiGuard Labs . Responsibilities The individual will be a key part of the corporate communications team, executing global social and digital media activities and programs across the company. Responsibilities Help manage the operations of our global social media team - platforms and enablement. Manage our company blog content and optimization. Help create engaging global social media activities across all parts of the Fortinet business from corporate and product, to cybersecurity training and threat intelligence. Use data and metrics from social content performance to provide important insights into dynamic social campaign ideas and report the overall function to management. Manage governance of social media platforms for the company. Qualifications And Experience 3-5+ years of experience in social media and/or digital marketing. Experience with SEO platforms and blog platforms for optimization efforts. Experience integrating and aligning social media activities with PR and corporate communications priorities. Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment; places high value on open communication, authenticity and transparency. Ability to thrive in fast-paced, quick-turn work environment while demonstrating good judgment and professionalism under pressure. Experience and knowledge of cybersecurity industry a plus. Bachelor degree required, advanced degree a plus.

Job Description Sr. Manager, Products & Solutions - SASE Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks #1 in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Fortinet’s comprehensive SASE solution to secure remote users powered by widely deployed FortiOS and FortiGuard AI-powered security services including SWG, FWaaS, ZTNA, CASB and more allowing organizations to shift from CAPEX to OPEX business mode. Fortinet SASE solution is seeing tremendous business growth and customer adoption. Fortinet is looking for an insightful and seasoned individual who to break through the noise and be able to effectively help create strategic ways to drive the business, comprehensive Secure Web Gateway and browser isolation solution as part of addressing broader SASE framework of delivering consistent web security posture for users on and off the network. The Role Will Be Expected To Lead strategy and execution of launching new solutions into the marketplace Engage with business leads to understand the product strategy/vision and collaborate on evolving the pricing and packaging of the offering Work closely with customers through various channels(EBCs, roadshows, and more) to understand product adoption, strengths and areas to improve Develop a compelling value proposition for your products with sustainable competitive advantage Analyze new routes to market and develop new go-to-market models to continue to drive product growth Understand market dynamics to ensure proper positioning of your products and ensure you have the right strategy to beat them Conduct regular market analysis and demonstrate thorough understanding of technology trends, competitive updates, channel performance, pricing and user requirements. Market knowledge and customer familiarity in the global midsize & enterprise segment Monitors revenue and initiates right actions to achieve targets. Actively engages with the sales organizations to understand market acceptance, develop sales plans, and understand feature/performance enhancements needed to maintain the product in the market over time. Qualifications Candidates should have the following qualifications but more importantly be passionate, energetic, and optimistic at heart. Expect to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and sometimes ambiguous environment. 3-5 years in Product Marketing, Product Management with demonstrated knowledge of technology Understanding of cybersecurity market, SASE, Secure Web Gateway (SWG), SD-WAN, ZTNA, and Browser Isolation(RBI) concepts Mature communication with partners, peers and managers. Skillful verbal and writing abilities and effective presentation skills a must. Good interpersonal skills and able to work well with people at all technical levels, all management levels, and with sales organizations. Ability to synthesize information from various sources to form own opinion and gain support from others. Proven track record of driving product messaging out to sales, channel and customers BS/BA minimum, MBA or related Master’s degree preferred.

The successful candidate should have relevant PR and communications work experience within the fast-paced cybersecurity industry and have a desire to move and execute quickly. The role will require strong media relations expertise as well as the experience to execute PR programs across product and partner areas of the business. Strong writing skills will be essential as part of day-to-day activities. Job Description Fortinet is looking for an Information Security Analyst to join a global Security Operations Center (SOC). This is a highly technical role, monitoring security events, identifying threats, assessing risks, providing incidence response, and working with leaders across Fortinet offices in the region to continue maturing Fortinet security posture and compliance. Fortinet SOC operates based on a follow the sun approach 24*7*365. Working hours for this position includes 5 days/40 hours per week, including Saturdays and Sundays and 3 weekdays of the candidate choice. Job Responsibilities Description for Internal Candidates As a member of the Global Security Operations team, you will monitor logs, review alerts and investigate events and security incidents leveraging SIEM, SOAR and other tools Develop SOC processes and playbooks, and implement alerts, reports and dashboards to identify threats and incidents. Collect, review, and analyze security logs, identify abnormalities and violations. Coach and assist system administrators, product and application developers and users to ensure that appropriate controls are implemented and operating effectively in accordance with policies. Ensure compliance to required standards, procedures, guidelines and processes. Skills And Qualifications 3+ years of experience in Information Technology or Information Security role. SOC/NOC experience desired. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills as well as attention to detail. Knowledge of Internet threat landscape and attacker motivations (phishing, malware, APT, DoS, etc.) Previous experience in an information systems or network administration role. Previous experience of at least one scripting language (e.g. Python, Groovy, Perl, Ruby, Shell scripting, etc.). Knowledge and experience working with various information security frameworks (ISO/IEC 27001, NIST 800-53, COBIT, etc) and regulatory frameworks (SOX, PCI-DSS 3.2, HIPAA, GDPR, etc.) Working knowledge of information security control technologies including access control, cryptography, vulnerability management, SIEM/log management, ID/IPS, and penetration test. Working knowledge on information technologies including Linux, Windows, VMWare, MySQL, MSSQL, Oracle, etc. Working knowledge of network protocols, DNS, and networking devices - routers, VPNs, proxies, firewalls. Demonstrate ability to engage and collaborate with employees, presenting a friendly, approachable demeanor to leverage security to help others succeed. Proficient in English verbal and written. Proficiency in regional languages, a plus. Job Description Responsibilities: Research, analyze, design and review system specifications of customer centric cloud security products. Job Description We are looking for a Systems Engineer to work closely with a Named Account Manager in a defined territory. The Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales organization in all technical matters regarding pre-sales, sales calls, and post-sales. Responsibilities Pre-sales - assist in qualifying sales leads from a technical standpoint. Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer or educate the customer and partner on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Conversant with networking applications and solutions. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Provide assistance to identified customers with post-sales training. Required Skills 5 – 8 years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer 5 - 7 years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Education Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. Job Description We are looking for a Systems Engineer to work closely with a Major Account Manager in a defined territory. The Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales organization in all technical matters regarding pre-sales, sales calls, and post-sales. Responsibilities Pre-sales - assist in qualifying sales leads from a technical standpoint. Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer or educate the customer and partner on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Conversant with networking applications and solutions. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Provide assistance to identified customers with post-sales training. Required Skills 5 – 8 years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer 5 - 7 years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Education Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. Job Description Job Duties : Conduct technical meetings with stakeholders within the assigned Carrier and Service Provider accounts to highlight Fortinet products and solutions Homologate the Fortinet Product Portfolio inside the Named Service Provider Accounts and provide support for the sales counterpart in order to position Fortinet products and technology as the standard offering for Managed Security Services (Sell-Through). Coordinate and run demo labs or proof-of-concepts required by customers, in order to shorten the sales cycle and effectively highlight Fortinet advantages over competitors. Create/Modify/Translate competitive documentation that can show in a convincing way, why Fortinet has a superior technology and product portfolio versus competitors, highlighting benefits to customers. Give proper follow-up to VIP projects and promptly report any advances or potential issues, so the sales counterpart can be aware and proactively work on the next step. Provide pre-sales technical support to Fortinet Sales representatives, Fortinet resellers and distributors, in order to positively influence sales and development of Fortinet Solutions offering within the account or territory (Latin America and the Caribbean). Support educational efforts (both in-classroom and remote via Webinars) targeted to keep a high degree of knowledge about Fortinet’s solutions, to the partner, reseller and distributor base. Create technical documents and/or presentations that can help the partner base to perform better/quicker/more impressive demonstrations, to effectively show Fortinet’ products strengths. Create/Modify/translate presentations as needed to effectively deliver Fortinet’s message to any type of audience. Be aware of business and technology trends that can impact the SD-WAN market in the future, so proper positioning can be developed around such trends in the SD-WAN market. Participate and be part of the feedback process to Research and Development, on information that flows from customers, partners and distributors, regarding potential improvements in Fortinet product line. Be part of the internal engineering communities (Tech Teams, Mailing lists, Partner Forums) and assist others within or outside the region, in order to make Fortinet more successful as a company. Take internal or external trainings as needed (including self-training modules) in order to keep product knowledge at the best possible, and be an expert resource for resellers, partners, distributors and other peers. Collaboratively work with peers within Latin America, in order to work on initiatives specific to the LATAM Market, which can help to give better service to our customers, partners and the security community in general. Job Experience / Abilities Required At least 5 years of experience on network infrastructure design & troubleshooting, Lan Switching (STP, PVST, MST, Trill and loop avoidance variants), Advanced Routing (OSPFv2 and BGPv4) and QoS mechanisms (Classification, Queueing, Congestion Avoidance, Shapping and Link efficiency mechanisms) Knowledge in IPv6, WLAN, mobile/packet core, 4G / LTE, VoLTE, metroethernet, CGNAT, GiFW, SecGW, MPLS, MPLS-TE, GTP/Carrier Firewalls, Cloud, Telco-Cloud and SD-WAN is a plus At least 3 years of experience on design, installation and/or operation of network security solutions, including: Firewalls, VPNs, IDP/IDS, Antivirus Gateways, Web Content Filtering, AntiSpam Previous experience (at least 3 years) working with Internet Service Providers or Wireless Service Providers either as an employee, partner or vendor attending the mentioned Named Account or technology (SD-WAN) on the location defined (Mexico and/or Colombia). Deep technical knowledge of SD-WAN technologies from the top recognized vendors from the industry. Strong understanding of common TCP/IP Service Protocols, such as ICMP, DNS, FTP, SMTP, HTTP, DNS, FTP, SMTP, HTTP, SNMP, SSH, RIP, OSPF, BGP, PPTP, L2TP, 802.1q, 802.1x Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: IPSec, SSL, 3DES, AES, SHA-1, MD5 Strong understanding of scripting and automation technologies based but not limited to: Python, Ruby, Perl, Ansible, Java, Terraform and general API development. Business oriented with sales skills. Experience on the design, installation and/or operation of network security solutions, including at least three of the following: Firewalls, VPNs, IDP/IPS, Antivirus Gateways, Web Content Filtering, AntiSpam, Vulnerability Managers, Database Security, VoIP Security. Knowledge and experience of authentication and cryptography systems, protocols and technologies such as LDAP, RADIUS, DIAMETER, TACACS+, Active Directory, Digital Certificates / PKI, SSL, IPSec, At least 2 product certifications on Networking, Firewalls, VPNs, IPS, Antivirus, AntiSpam, URL Filtering or Vulnerability Managers; that can be from Fortinet or from other competitor products is a plus. At least 3 years of experience with engineering presales activities, including: Sales meetings, Proof-of-concepts, Technical trainings, product sizing, solution design, assisting on creating sales proposals (with sales persons) and answering RFPs / public bids. Bilingual: Strong oral and written communication skills, both in Spanish and English. Exceptional ability to clearly articulate messages in English and Spanish. Portuguese and/or French are a plus. Strong analytical skills, oriented to details. Ability to be autodidact and learn new knowledge areas on his/her own. Proven track record as a problem solver. Highly organized. Capable of working and multi-tasking across multiple projects. Self-motivated, with ability to work without direct supervision. Adaptable and flexible, operating in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Ability to work and take quick decisions under pressure. Availability to travel up to 30% of the time and on short notice. Other Job Requirements Bachelor / Engineering degree on Computer Science, Electronics or Telecommunications granted by a university recognized by the local Education System and/or Education Authority. Must be a citizen or be legal resident and have a valid working visa in Colombia. Must currently live in Bogota, or close enough to attend daily meetings in the city Fortinet has been built on diversity. Our company is a diverse workplace resulting from an integrated team with true international representation and contributors with a variety of talents, backgrounds, experiences, and approaches . W e have an equal and transparent selection process, you will be considered regardless of gender, race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, or disability. In fact, if you have any disability that requires for us to do any accommodation, please contact us at accommadations@fortinet.com .

Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer or educate the customer and partner on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Conversant with networking applications and solutions. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Provide assistance to identified customers with post-sales training. Required Skills 5 – 8 years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer 5 - 7 years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration Proven understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Solid understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Exceptional presentation skills Education Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. Graduate Degree favorable

Job Description Fortinet EDR/XDR Commercial Sales Engineer The Commercial Sales Engineer role is a pre-sales engineering role combined with project management skills for managing multiple concurrent PoC’s and developing sales strategies for enterprise accounts. The Role's Primary Responsibilities Are To Manage pre-sales engagements to demonstrate business value derived from Fortinet EDR/XDR solutions. Excellent verbally communication skills for delivering high quality, engaging product demos. Collaborate with field Account Teams customer engagements. Provide technical selling guidance to field sales-engineers as needed. Basic knowledge of other Fortinet products for integration with EDR/XDR solution. Own the technical Proof of Concept process. Escalate any issues to SE/Sales Leadership as well as support resources as needed. Strong understanding of competitive landscape. Ability to clearly articulate competitive advantages, both technical and business level. Knowledge and experience of selling Managed Detection and Response (MDR) service as well as Incident Response offerings. Deliver outstanding customer experience during PoC to support hand-off. Travel to customer locations as needed Deep understanding of protection methods for Windows, Linux and Mac OS Knowledge of Mitre Attack Methods required Python scripting knowledge highly desired

Responsibilities Pre-sales - assist in qualifying sales leads from a technical standpoint. Sales calls - be the main technical resource on sales calls and answer/ educate the customer on issues ranging from features, specifications and functionality to integration. Conversant with networking applications and solutions. Post-sales - be the lead technical contact for identified accounts for technical issues and will work closely with the technical support team and engineering to answer, elevate and resolve customer's technical issues. Provide assistance to identified customers with post-sales training. Required Skills 5 – 8 years experience in technical/pre-sales support as a sales or systems engineer 5 - 7 years experience in LAN/WAN/Internet services administration Strong understanding of DNS and NFS, SMTP, HTTP, TCP/IP Knowledge of the following technologies: Routing, Switching, VPN, LAN, WAN, Network Security, Intrusion Detection, and Anti Virus. Strong understanding in the following technologies and protocols: RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES Experience with encryption and authentication technologies required Strong presentation skills Education Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience. Graduate degree preferred. About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommadations@fortinet.com. Fortinet is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in our company, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

Job Description We are looking for an experienced Sourcer with previous experience sourcing Sales Representatives and Technical professionals at an all levels. The ideal candidate is someone who understands the competitive nature of this market and knows how to build a strong candidate pipeline from scratch. Responsibilities Source candidates to build the candidate pipeline through sourcing, networking, referrals, events, online postings, etc. Contribute to the overall recruitment strategy to ensure management expectations are met. Manage sourcing process, determine candidate’s skill level and compatibility with the job function. Deliver consistently positive candidate experience. Continuously follow-up with Recruiters and VP of Talent Acquisition to confirm staffing plans and ensure hiring manager’s resume needs are met . High attention to detail and the ability to work with Recruiters to prioritize candidates and roles to meet hiring needs. Problem-solving mindset with the ability to work with a sense of competitive urgency. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on tact and diplomacy. Job Description The Product Security Incident Response Team is looking for a Product Penetration Tester to handle Product Penetration Testing and to perform vulnerability research on Fortinet products. Duties Responsible for scoping and execution of penetration tests against a variety of technologies including appliance, virtual machine, web application, desktop application mobile and infrastructure Provide appliance/application vulnerability assessment and penetration testing, identifying weaknesses and vulnerabilities within the system and proposing countermeasures Proof-of-concept exploits that simulate adversarial capabilities against systems, and author technical documentation of research or findings as it relates to all security mechanisms such as access control, networking and encryption Find and report unknown vulnerabilities in Fortinet products via black box analysis, fuzzing, and other penetration testing techniques. Research on new attack vectors, discover new vulnerabilities, create new exploitation techniques, Developing sophisticated, state-of-the-art attacks that integrate the latest attack methods against embedded products Creating novel tools such as fuzzers to assist in project goals Skills Experience conducting vulnerability assessments and penetration testing for appliances and web applications and client applications. Experience with tools such as Qualys, Nessus, AppScan, WebInspect, HP Fortify, Experience with fuzzing tools Experience conducting vulnerability assessments and penetration testing for Mobile applications a plus. Deep understanding of SANS Top 20, OWASP Top 10, etc Deep understanding of OS Security, including Linux, Windows, MacOS Hands on software development experience Ability to reverse engineer binaries a plus. Good understanding of vulnerabilities at source-code level Ability to communicate security issues to technical and non-technical audience. Ability to collaborate with a variety of internal stakeholders (security champions, product managers, development teams, security architects) to deliver high quality penetration tests. Good understanding of Fortinet product line-up, solid security background, in-depth understanding of penetration testing, asymmetric cryptography, scripting knowledge, oriented and able to follow processes thoroughly. Qualifications Interest in security vulnerabilities and exploitation (as a practitioner) OSCP, GPEN, CEH, LPT,CISSP or other industry security certification Bachelor's and Master's Degree in Computer Science, Technical, Engineering, Education, Computer Engineering, Information Security, Information Technology, Technology, Computer, Cyber Security. Exceptions to the above will be made for those with a proven experience. #GD About Us Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Job Description The Product Security Incident Response Team is looking for a Team Leader for the Product Security Engineer team to manage the team handling Product Security related incidents, and to perform vulnerability research on Fortinet products. The ideal candidate will have experience in reviewing and auditing large possible implications of defects, undefined behavior, and fault conditions therein. Duties Manage a team of product security engineers as part of a follow the sun global team, coordinating resources and ensure that that PSIRT tickets are being managed in a timely and professional manner. Job Description The Bilingual Technical Customer Success Manager is responsible for building relationships with our customers in LATAM, ensuring that they’re getting the most out of FortiMonitor. By interfacing with sales, product, threat research, marketing and support, you will bring our various internal teams to bear in order to support your customers. Job Description Fortinet is a leading global cybersecurity company, and we’re looking for a Technical Accounting Intern to join in the summer of 2022. The internship provides an excellent opportunity for an individual who takes the initiative, is self-motivated, a quick learner, is comfortable with technology and learning new accounting systems, and wants to gain broad experience supporting the accounting department. If you are looking for a career in a high-energy, professional work environment at a company that values and rewards your contributions, challenges you to shape your career path, and provides top-notch personal development in that case, this is an opportunity for you. As a Technical Accounting Intern, you will engage in problem-solving of various accounting matters, research on technical guidance, and prepare internal presentations and analyses for the management team. In addition, you’ll be exposed to nearly every aspect of the finance function in the business and gain a keen understanding of what a career in finance looks like in real life. Besides working on impactful projects, you will participate in a lunch and learn session with our executives, networking activity, and project showcase during the internship. Position Summary The Technical Accounting Manager position reports to the Technical Accounting Senior Manager and will perform a variety of technical accounting tasks related to the Company’s real estate activities including the accounting for property purchases and special projects. The role will partner with Facilities and Real Estate Teams, Regional Accounting Teams, and other business owners to maintain accurate accounting and reporting. Given the Company’s continued high growth, the position will serve a role in process and system initiatives. Responsibilities Coordinate and oversee accounting for purchased properties and determine technical accounting conclusions. Document the Company’s position and conclusions in formal technical accounting memos. Assist in the development and documentation of key accounting policies and procedures. Support special project efforts for the Company’s lease accounting and operational tool and for other accounting systems. Serve as a subject matter expert in evaluating new system or process initiatives and related internal controls. Develop and maintain professional relationships across Finance, Facilities and Real Estate teams. Supervise 1 Senior Technical Accounting Analyst. Other duties as assigned. Requirements Demonstrates the ability to be versatile and willingness to jump in where needed. Must be comfortable with technology and learning new accounting systems. LeaseQuery or equivalent system experience a plus. Innovative, team-oriented, an effective communicator, have a desire to participate in change and ability to prioritize projects in a fast-paced environment. Attention to detail and thoroughness is essential. Ability to take full ownership of assignments and be self-motivated. CPA preferred, BA degree in Accounting or Finance with 3+ years applicable experience, combination of Big 4 plus technology company preferred.

Job Description Technical Marketing Engineer Organization Overview The Technical Marketing Organization works alongside the Product Marketing and training teams. Objective The technical marketing engineer would be the global subject matter expert for 1 or more Fortinet products. Responsibilities The role requires the person to become of the subject matter expert for 1 or more products. This is achieved mainly through setting up the desired systems up in a lab environment but also continued communication with Development Head, PM, PMM and SE’s. The TME would be expected to answer technical field questions via email or collaboration tools and help when requested to present the product via conference calls or within the Executive Briefing center The TME would be part of a larger group of Fortinet experts that facilitates specific customer group interaction. Another key function would be hands on competitive assessments based on setting up the different systems in a lab then producing a report based on the analysis. The TME would work closely with the PM and PMM to provide technical direction and validation on any campaign assets that are being developed. In addition support the PM in making sure the product demo is updated and running. Required Skills The skills are very technical with the candidate being able to set up and Fortinet and competitive products. Expert and real world knowledge in any of the following Network Security Products such as Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Email Gateways, Web Gateways, Sandboxing, Web Application Firewalls, Authentication, Wireless, Endpoint and ADC’s. Education University degree preferred but not mandated. Experience in building customer networks can counter any formal education.

Job Description The Bilingual Support Engineer fulfills a hybrid operations role that crosses the traditional boundaries between customer support and technical operations. This role will start off with supporting FortiMonitor, a leading infrastructure monitoring and incident management platform. The platform is a highly technical product with a savvy, intelligent user base of IT professionals. Over time, this will expand to include other Fortinet security software solutions and services. In this role, you will be interacting directly with these customers to both help them make better use of our service as well as gathering feedback and recommendations for our product team to further enhance our offering. Description for Internal Candidates In This Role, You’ll Support our customers Our interaction with customers is primarily through email, chat and phone calls. You’ll be talking directly with customers, but won’t be handling the usual “password reset” requests - the types of questions we receive generally revolve around deeper usage and best practices issues and often evolve into collaborative projects working with customers to extend our service to fit their needs. Champion the needs of our customers Our product and service offering is heavily driven by customer requests and suggestions. In this role, you will be in a position to distill customer feedback and push for additions and improvements that will better serve our entire customer base. Be exposed to a wide range of technology Our monitoring system works with mainframes in a corporate datacenter to the latest cloud services at AWS and Azure, and everything in between. You’ll get to learn about and work with each of these as part of your regular responsibilities Work closely with the rest of the team You will get a chance to work alongside engineering, marketing, sales and operations, sharing your experiences and learning from theirs. This is a great opportunity for individuals who love technology and are looking to branch out and take on more responsibilities in a growing business unit within a larger company. Qualifications Ability to speak clearly & confidently about technology and internet concepts and interact with technical customers via email, phone and chat Must be fluent in Spanish Familiarity and technical understanding of core Internet technology (DNS, HTTP, TCP/IP, routing, firewalls, etc.) Deep experience running Linux or Unix in real-world production environments preferably at scale. At least general experience with basic Windows operation and administration. Experience using SQL queries to find data Experience with Docker Experience with Network devices (switch/router/firewall) and SNMP General experience with WebServers (IIS and/or Apache and/or Nginx) Genera experience with cloud providers- AWS/Azure/GCP General experience with virtualization hypervisors – Vmware/HyperV General understanding of container orchestration systems, preferably Kubernetes General experience with Python, PowerShell, Perl or Ruby and a tool-building mindset for developing the right scripts for client integration and automation A team-oriented attitude and interest in working closely with other groups in the company. Strong organizational skills and the ability to properly prioritize operations, customer impacting issues and project tasks. Bonus points for experience working with other monitoring tools - open source, commercial, or SaaS-based. Educational Requirements Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field, or an equivalent combination of training and experience is desirable. alignment with Sales Leader account, opportunity and deal forecasting Lead, manage and orchestrate Technical Escalations in your area for efficient and effective collaboration with Consulting Systems Engineering and Product Management Contributes directly to selling efforts such as executive/key leader-relationships, vision presentations, roadmap presentations, PoV value wrap-ups, etc. Develops
